Manchu: elhe taifin-i sohon bonio juwan uyuci aniya.
English: the year of the Yellow Monkey, nineteenth year of Kangxi.
Source: The Diary of a Manchu Soldier in Seventeenth-Century China
Comment: Manchu written in romanised transliteration system emloyed by Paul Georg von Möllendorff

Manchu: aniya biyai ice inenggi.
English: On the first day of the first month,

Manchu: jiyanggiyun manggitu. hebei ambasa. geren janggisa. ba na i hafasa be gaifi.
English: General Manggitu led the councilors, officers, and local officials.

Manchu: guwangsi nan ning fui hoton i dung yoo miyoo i dolo tese isibufi doroloho.
English: and gathered them at the Dongyue temple in the prefectural city of Nanning in Guangxi province, where they together performed a ritual ceremony.

Manchu: ambasa juwe galai hafasa ishunde hengkilehe.
English: The high dignitaries and the officers of the two wings saluted each other by kowtowing.

Manchu: aniyai ucuri jakun gusai janggin cooha gemu jeme omime.
English: On the occasion of the New Year all officers and soldiers of the Eight Banners drank and ate.

Manchu: bayara uksin i beye giyade. hehe adali miyamifi.
English: The bayara guards and the armored soldiers were in the streets, in women’s clothes and make-up.

Manchu: doo yang ke ucun be uculeme efihe.
English: enjoying themselves singing the song doo yang ke.
Comment: change ba to be (miswritten in the original manchu diary)

Manchu: mini dolo sakdasa be gūnime ališaha.
English: In my heart, I felt sad thinking about [my] old folks.

Manchu: juwe biyai orin sunja de.
English: On the twenty-fifth of the second month,

Manchu: horon be badarambure amba jiyanggiyun.
English: Field Marshal of the Second Rank.

Manchu: julergi be necihiyere wang šang jy sin.
English: Prince Pacifier of the South Shang Zhi xin.

Manchu: julergi be tuwakiyara jiyanggiyūn manggitu.
English: Protector of the South General Manggitu.

Manchu: giyangning ni jergi babe tuwakiyara jiyanggiyūn ecu.
English: Protector of Jiangning and other places General Ecu.

Manchu: hebei amban gusai ejen lebei. hife.
English: Councilors and Lieutenant-generals Lebei and Hife.

Manchu: meiren i janggin ehene se yun nan be gaime dosire jalin hebe acafi. tuweri dosimbi seme toktoho.
English: Major-general Ehene met in council to discuss strategies of how to enter and take Yunnan, then decided to launch the expedition in winter.

Manchu: bi morin be ulebume maikan enggemu.agūra hajun be dasataha.
English: I fed the horses and prepared my tent, saddle, and weapons.

Manchu: ilan biyai ice ilan de.dergici wasimbuha šang cuwan de.
English: On the third day of the third month an imperial edict was issued.

Manchu: sycuwan-i golo be baha be dahame.
English: After Sichuan province has been secured.

Manchu: kemungge wang-ni cooha be.guwangsi-i golo hoton gui lin fude emu nirui emte be werifi
English: out of all the troops of the Frugal Prince, each niru must leave one soldier in the city of Guilin of the Guangxi province.

Manchu: wang-ni beye cooha be gaifi. lio jeo fu be tuwakiyakini.
English: The Prince himself will then lead his troops to protect the city of Liuzhou.

Manchu: anda wang šang jy sin ini harangga cooha be gaifi. gui hiyan be tuwakiyakini.
English: The anda Prince Shang Zhi xin, heading the troops under his command, must defend Gui county.

Manchu: juwe guwang-ni dzungdu gin guwang dzu. jurgan be dahaha be ma ciyang yin sei cooha be . jiyangiyūn manggitu gaifi . yūn nan be gaime dosikini sehebi.
English: General Manggitu, leading the troops of Lieutenant-general Liu Yanming and those subordinated to the governor-general of the two Guang Provinces. Jin Guangzu, the Count Follower of Justice Ma Chengyin, shall enter and conquer Yunnan.

Manchu: mini gamara yaya jaka be gemu dasataha.
English: I prepared all the provisions to take with me.

Manchu: ice sunja de.
English: On the fifth,

Manchu: dosire inenggi hanci oho,agūra hajun be sadata seme selgiyehe.
English: as we approached the day of departure,  we were ordered to prepare the weapons.

Manchu: ice ninggun de.
English: On the sixth,

Manchu: ganduhai buyarame janggisa morin-i ton be ciralame baicaha.
English: Ganduhai and his lower officers thoroughly checked the number of the horses.

Manchu: bin jeo-i jy jeo hafan ma ciyang yen be ubašaha seme nurhume boolanjiha.
English: The Department Magistrate of the Binzhou district reported repeatedly that Ma Chengyin had rebelled.

Manchu: juwan ilan de.
English: On the thirteenth,

Manchu: jiyangiyūn manggitu gūsai ejen hife. tui janggin ehene de emu nirui ilata bayara dahame dailara sunja ing-ni sunja minggan niowanggiyan tu cooha be bufi.
English: General Manggitu gave Lieutenant-general Hife and Major-general of the Guards Ehene three bayara guards from each niru, along with 5,000 Green Standard troops from the five expeditionary battalions.

Manchu: neneme ubašaha hūlha ma ciyang yen be dailame bin jeo baru jurambuha.
English: bidding them to leave for Binzhou to fight against the rebellious bandit Ma Chengyin.

Manchu: tere inenggi mini jakūn morin hūlhabufi.
English: This same day eight horses of mine were stolen.

Manchu: mini dolo ališame.
English: I felt sad and distraught.

Manchu: jiyangiyūn de alara jakade. jianggiyun sunja ing-ni hafasa. irgen de selgiyefi baicabuha. naranggi baha akū
English: When I reported the theft to the general, he informed the officers and commoners of the five battalions to investigate, but in the end I did not get [the horses] back
Comment: Changed the sentence to fit the manchu sentence format

Manchu: juwan ninggude
English: On the sixteenth

Manchu: jiyangiyūn ecu. cooha gaifi yung šun hiyan ci cuwan tefi. nan ning de jihe.
English: General Ecu, at the head of his troops, came by boat from Yongchun county to Nanning.

Manchu: orin de yung šun-i coohai morisa isinjiha
English: The military horses of Yongchun arrived on the twentieth.

Manchu: jiyangiyūn gisun morin akū uksin sade yung šun-i alban-i morin be tatame gaifi bu seme tatarade lak seme burakū ofi. genere kūwaran da be uhuken seme dangsifi .
English: The general ordered that the government horses [that arrived] from Yongchun be requisitioned and given to the armored soldiers who had no horses. Because at the time of the requisition [the soldiers] were unwilling to give up [the horses] [the general] reprimanded the camp commanders in charge saying that they were weak.

Manchu: jiyanggiyūn manggitu. tuwakiyara kūwaran-i da janggisa be gajifi . morin be burakūngge adarame . emke hono faššame yabuki serakū jileršembi. te uthai alban-i morin be bu seme.
English: General Manggitu summoned the officers and camp commanders on duty and told them: “Why are the horses not being handed over? You are ignoring [my order]. And refusing to make even a single effort! You must give up the government horses immediately.”
Comment: change the abbr. mang to manggitu

Manchu: morin be tatame gaifi.genere cooha de icihiyame buhe.
English: Then the horses were requisitioned and allocated in an appropriate manner to the departing soldiers.

Manchu: orin sunja de
English: On the twenty-fifth

Manchu: bi. jiyangiyūn mang. gūsai ejen lebei. hife sebe dahame. emu nirui duite ton-i cooha be gaifi. nan ning fuci. lio jeo baru jurafi yabume. jin ceng sy be dulefi . gun luwan guwan be tucifi .
English: I followed General Manggitu, Lieutenant-generals Lebei and Hife, who were leading a force made of four soldiers from each company. From the city of Nanning we set out towards the prefectural city of Liuzhou, passed Jinchengzhai, and crossed the Kunlun Pass.

Manchu: sunja inenggi emu tanggū nadanju babe yabufi. gūsin de bin jeo de isinafi.
English: Covering 170 li in five days, on the thirtieth we reached Binzhou.

Manchu: neneme genehe bayara be acafi. aliha cooha be acabufi emu meyen obuha.
English: We caught up with the bayara troops that had set off earlier and, joining the Manchu-Mongol cavalry, we formed a squadron.

Manchu: duin biyai ice de.
English: On the first day of the fourth month,

Manchu: mini jalan-i booju nirui hoošan-i kutule.
English: the servants of Hoošan of the Booju company of my regiment,

Manchu: gūwa-i waha irgen-i ihan-i yali be dendefi gajirede. jiyangiyūn-i gocika uksin de nambufi.
English: brought and shared the meat of a cow belonging to common people that had been killed by others. They were apprehended by the armored soldiers of general's personal guard.
Comment: common people - civilian?

Manchu: jiyanggiyun. mimbe. kūwaran-i da be gamafi.
English: The general summoned me and the camp commanders,

Manchu: cacari de tebufi.
English: made us sit in [his] tent.

Manchu: sain gisun-i necihiyere de. be yertehe.
English: He comforted us with good words, but we felt ashamed.

Manchu: weile gisurefi. ganduhai ilan biyai funglu. mimbe. arahai janggin dandai be ninggun biyai funglu faitame.
English: After the crime was adjudicated, Ganduhai was sentenced three months of salary, I and the assistant adjutant Dandai to a fine of six months of salary,
Comment: Corrected mimne to the right spelling mimbe based on the orginal diary

Manchu: bošokū be nadanju. kutule-i ejen hoošan be jakūnju. kutule be tanggū tantaha.
English: the corporal to seventy cane strokes, the slave master Hoošan to eighty, and the servants to a 100.

Manchu: uheri coohai jetere bele lakcafi.
English: after the food supplies for the whole army had been used up,

Manchu: ice duide
English: On the fourth,

Manchu: jiyangiyūn ing gurime. bin jeo ci tofohon bai dubede genefi ing ilifi. teisu teisu gašan de bele baisu. handu be niohu seme selgiyehe.
English: the general gave the order to move camp, to set up a new camp at a distance of 15 li from Binzhou, to search for rice in every single village, and to pound the unhusked rice.

Manchu: bi booi juse be gašan de unggifi. eye feteme handu baifi gajifi.
English: I sent the family boy-servants to the village. Digging up pits they found the unhusked rice, and brought it [to me].
Comment: Corrected fatame to the right spelling feteme based on the origin

Manchu: na be sangga arafi bele niohuhe.
English: Then they dug holes into the ground, and pounded the rice.

Manchu: ice ninggude
English: On the sixth

Manchu: bin jeo-i bira be fukiyoo ca seme. niowanggiyan tu de afabuha.
English: ordered the Green Standard troops to build a pontoon bridge across the river at Binzhou.
Comment: Deleted added subject [General Manggitu] to align with the origin

Manchu: ice jakūn de
English: On the eighth

Manchu: jurgan ci unggihe bithede. ubašaha hūlha ma ciyang yen be kemungge wang. anda wang šang jy sin ni emgi acafi dailakini. jiyangiyūn manggitu si yūn nan be dailame dosika akū babe hudun boola sehebi.
English: a document arrived from the Ministry, which said: “The Frugal Prince and the Anda Prince Shang Zhixin must join and subdue the rebellious bandit Ma Chengyin after having joined. You, General Manggitu, must report at once about the reason why you have not yet attacked and invaded Yunnan.”
Comment: Deleted added translation [their forces]. Corrected spelling mistake [mannitu - manggitu] based on the origin

Manchu: geli fugiyan-i goloi hai cing hiyan. gin men. hiya men-i jergi babe baha seme donjiha.
English: We heard that the localities of Haicheng county, Jinmen and Xiamen in the province of Fujian had also been taken.

Manchu: juwan ilan de
English: On the thirteenth

Manchu: geli yūn nan be gaime dosi seme hacihiyara bithe isinjiha.
English: an urgent dispatch arrived ordering us to proceed with the occupation of Yunnan.

Manchu: juwan ninggude
English: On the sixteenth

Manchu: cooha kutule be irgen be nungnembi seme. gemu karun ci ume tucibure seme fafun-i bithe selgiyehe.
English: because the troops and servants were harming the civilian population, a legal decree was issued to the effect that nobody was allowed to leave his post.

Manchu: juwan uyūn de
English: On the nineteenth

Manchu: bin jeo-i bira be doofi. tofohon ba yabufi. ma moo san-i ebele too deng sere babe ing iliha.
English: crossed the river, marched for 15 li, and set up camp in a place called Taodeng on the near side of the Shamao Mountain.

Manchu: bi orhoi tatan araha.
English: I made a grass shelter.

Manchu: anda wang-ni yabubuha bithede.
English: A dispatch sent by the Anda Prince read:

Manchu: dzungdu gin mukei cooha be gaifi. juwan ilan de cuwan be jurambi.
English: Governor-general Jin [Guangzu] shall take the marines and set out by boat on the thirteenth.

Manchu: mini beye. tidu jelken-i emgi cooha be gaifi. tofohon de olhon be jurambi.
English: I myself, together with Provincial Commander-in-Chief Jelken, will proceed with our troops by land on the fifteenth.

Manchu: lai bin hiyan be wesihun jiyangiyūn gaisu .
English: Honorable General shall take Laibin county
Comment: Deleted added translation [Manggitu] [You] to align with the Manchu context

Manchu: bi u siowan hiyan be gaifi. dere acafi hebdeki. eici kemungge cin wang be aliyafi lio jeo fu be gaire. eici musei cooha uthai lio jeo fu be gaire babe ebešeki sehebi:
English: after I take Wuxuan county, we shall meet in person to deliberate whether, we should wait for the Frugal Prince of the Blood before we seize the prefectural city of Liuzhou, or whether our troops should immediately [proceed to] take Liuzhou Fu.

Manchu: yun gui-i dzungdu baturu bodohonggo jiyangiyūn joo liyang dung-ni wesimbuhengge. fudaraka hūlha u san gui.u guwe gui bucehe:funcehe u ing ki.u ši fan.hu guwe ju.ma boo se gemu silhi meijehebi. muten akū urse. ere sucuwan be baha ucuri. duin jugun-i sasa yun gui be gaime dosici.emgeride toktobuci ombi seme narhūšame wesimbuhe seme donjiha.
English:
I heard that the Governor-general of Yunnan and Guizhou Heroic Strategist General Zhao Liangdong had secretly memorialized [as follows]:
The rebellious bandits Wu Sangui and Wu Guogui have died. The remaining Wu Yingqi, Wu Shifan, Hu Guozhu, Ma Bao, and others have lost their nerve. They are incompetent people. This is the time to take Sichuan. If we proceed to take Yunnan and Guizhou with a syn- chronized attack from four routes, it is possible to suppress the rebellion in one stroke.

Manchu: orin ilan de
English: On the twenty-third

Manchu: lai bin-i baru ibembi seme gisurefi nakaha.
English: the consultation ended with a decision to advance towards Laibin.

Manchu: emu biyai jetere bele niohu seme selgiyehe.
English: issued an order to pound enough rice for one month.

Manchu: bi eye fetebume handu baifi. bele niohuhe.
English: I ordered people to dig a storage pit, take the unhusked rice, and pound it to get husked rice.
Comment: Corrected Manchu spelling by to bi based on the origin

Manchu: orin jakūn de
English: On the twenty-eighth

Manchu: hūlha-i mejige be gaime. cooha unggirede. bi genehe bihe.
English: some soldiers were sent to gather information about the rebels. I went, too.

Manchu: orin uyūn de mini beye fudame nimehe.
English: On the twenty-ninth I became sick and vomited.

Manchu: sunja biyai ice sunja de
English: On the fifth of the fifth month

Manchu: elhe cin wang-ni beye cooha gaifi. beging-ni baru bederehe seme donjifi. bi elhe wang be dahame tucifi. elemangga bahafi bedererakū seme gusucehe.
English: I heard that the Peaceful Prince of the Blood was taking in person his troops back to Beijing. I left to follow the Peaceful Prince, but I did not manage to be sent back with him. I felt demoralized.

Manchu: ice nadan de
English: On the seventh
Comment: Correct Manchu spelling based on modern orthography

Manchu: yūn nan ci jihe hūlha fan ci han. jan yang-ni cooha. ma ciyang yen-i cooha lai bin-i bira be doofi. da ši kiyoo de iliha seme donjifi.
English: I heard that the soldiers of the rebels Fan Qihan and Zhan Yang who had come from Yunnan, and the soldiers of Ma Chengyin, after crossing the river at Laibin, camped at Dashiqiao.

Manchu: jiyangiyūn manggitu geren de selgiyefi ing be akdulara de.
English: Thereupon by General Manggitu issued a universal order to fortify every encampment.
Comment: change the abbr. mang to manggitu

Manchu: mini beye cooha be kadalame dobori dulime keremu ulan weilehe.
English: I was put personally in charge of the troops to construct during the night shift a camp wall and a moat.

Manchu: coohai urse gasaha.
English: All the soldiers complained.

Manchu: juwan ilan de hūlha ibeme jifi. bakcilame sunja bai dubede. alin be gaime ing iliha.
English: On the thirteenth the rebels advanced, and facing us at a distance of 5 li, they occupied the mountain top and set up camp there.

Manchu: jiyanggiyun. niowanggiyan tu be musei cooha de kamcibume keremu tuwakiyabuha.
English: The general ordered the Green Standard forces to combine with our troops and guard the camp wall.

Manchu: mini beye dobori inenggi akū uksilehei jucelehe.
English: I wore my armor night and day and stood guard.

Manchu: tofohon de
English: On the fifteenth

Manchu: ubašaha hūlha ma ciyang yen-i fejergi holo jiyangiyūn ma ciyang liyei. r'ao i lung. yūn nan ci jihe hūlha-i holo jiyangiyūn fan ci han. jan yang uheri tumen funcere hūlha be gaifi. ing be afanjime hanci latunjifi.
English: the false generals Ma Chenglie and Rao Yilong, subordinate to the rebel bandit Ma Chengyin, together with the false generals Fan Qihan and Zhan Yang, who had come from Yunnan, jointly leading over 10,000 rebels, advanced forward, pressing on to attack [our] camp.

Manchu: too deng-ni bade hiyahan kalka miyoocan sufan duin be faidafi ambarame jehe be. jiyangiyūn manggitu ing toome emu janggin. juwan uksin be werifi. uheri amba cooha be gaifi tucifi.
English: In the locality of Taodeng, they arranged in good order their chevaux-de-frise, shields, muskets, and elephants in four rows, and came forward in an imposing manner. General Manggitu, leaving in each encampment one officer and ten armored soldiers, came out at the head of the whole army.

Manchu: cin-i dere de hife. masitai be jai meyen-i cooha be gaifi faida.
English: He ordered Hife and Masitai to take position in front with the troops of the second squadron.

Manchu: ici ergi šakšaha de ehene uju meyen-i cooha be gaifi faida.
English: Then he ordered Ehene to take position on the right flank at the head of the soldiers of the first squadron.
Comment: Correct Manchu spelling to šakšaha based on modern orthography

Manchu: hashu ergi šakšaha de lebei šakšaha meyen-i cooha be gaifi faida seme afabufi.
English: He also ordered Lebei to deploy on the left flank with the troops of the wing column.
Comment: Correct Manchu spelling to šakšaha based on modern orthography

Manchu: niowanggiyan tu be juleri sindafi.
English: He lined up the Green Standard troops in front.

Manchu: ibeme poo sindame.
English: moved forward firing cannon.

Manchu: hūlha uthai fondolome latunjifi.
English: The rebels immediately rushed forward breaking through.
Comment: Deleted added translation [our lines].

Manchu: niowanggiyan tu alime muterakū aššame.
English: The Green Standard troops were not able to hold [them] and vacillated.

Manchu: gulu suwayan gulu fulgiyan juwe hontoho fakcame angga arame ba buhe.
English: The Plain Yellow and the Plain Red [Banners] broke into two halves, creating an opening.

Manchu: hūlha bireme emu dalgan-i fondolofi. baksalafi bedererede.
English: As the rebels penetrated in one whole group [we] split into small groups and withdrew.

Manchu: tuwaci jebele galai baru siribume kubuhe lamun. hūlhai hiyahan-i hanci ilinaha.
English: One could see that as our western flank was being pressed on, the Bordered Blue [Banner] was being pushed up against the rebels’ chevaux-de-frise.

Manchu: hūlhai piciyang turi tashara adali sindambi.
English: The rebels’ musket fire sounded like frying beans.

Manchu: tuwaci uju meyen-i cooha sufan be birebufi.
English: Following that, the soldiers of the first column were attacked by the elephants.

Manchu: kubuhe suwayan-i bayara janggin walda tu. aliha cooha-i funde bošokū ulehi-i tu gaibuha.
English: The flags of Major-general of the Guards Walda of the Yellow Banner, and of Lieutenant Ulehi of the Manchu-Mongol cavalry were captured.

Manchu: sufan halgime jai meyen-i cooha de nikenjihe be. meni geren-i gabtara de. sirdan sengge bula-i adali.
English: As the elephants closed in on the encircled soldiers of the second column, the arrows shot by all of my men looked like the quills of a porcupine.
Comment: Correct Manchu spelling gabdara to gabtara based on modern orthography

Manchu: sufan de hadara jakade. sufan burulame alin-i baru genehe. mini dolo faijuma seme gūnime tuksitehe.
English: The elephants fled towards the hills [but] I was greatly alarmed and had a strange feeling.
Comment: Correct Manchu spelling faijeme to faijuma based on modern orthography

Manchu: hūlha necin baci ikume. alin-i luku bujan de kurelefi.
English: The rebels withdrew from the plain and split into groups in the thick forest of the mountain.
Comment: Correct Manchu spelling kurlefi to kurelefi based on modern orthography

Manchu: yamjitala bakcilame hiyahan faidafi bihe.
English: As evening fell, they lined up chevaux-de-frise facing opposite.

Manchu: musei cooha inu afahakū.
English: Our soldiers also did not attack

Manchu: ing de bederefi.
English: returned to the encampment

Manchu: keremu be akdulame tuwakiyaha.
English: protected by strengthening the ramparts.

Manchu: juwan ninggun-i yamji
English: On the evening of the sixteenth

Manchu: jiyangiyūn manggitu-ni beye juwe tanggū siliha cooha be gaifi.hūlhai hanci genefi.
English: General Manggitu personally rode out at the head of 200 select troops.

Manchu: ergide kaicame. cargide burdeme hūlha be burgibuha.
English: As they drew closer to the bandits, they frightened them yelling here and blowing the conch there.

Manchu: hūlhai holo jiyangiyūn fan ci han. jan yang. ma ciyang liyei se juwan nadan-i dobori burulaha.
English: The false bandit generals Fan Qihan, Zhan Yang, Ma Chenglie, and others fled on the night of the seventeenth.

Manchu: gereke manggi. jiyangiyūn manggitu ing de emu nirui emte cooha be werifi. amba cooha be gaifi fargade. bi genehe bihe.
English: At daybreak General Manggitu, leaving inside the camp one soldier from each company, pursued [them] with the whole army, and I went along, too.
Comment: Correct Manchu spelling to fargade based on modern orthography

Manchu: hūlhai amcabufi dahahangge. jiyangiyūn gemu waha akū sindaha.
English: For those bandits who were pursued and surrendered, the General did not kill them all.
Comment: Change the translation to better align with the Manchu context

Manchu: dobori dulime ing de bederehe.
English: we returned to the camp in the middle of the night.

Manchu: jiyangiyūn manggitu oncoi baktambume. musei cooha be umai sehe akū.
English: General Manggitu was lenient and forgiving, and without saying anything at all about our soldiers

Manchu: juwe tumen isire hūlha be ambarame gidafi waha.
English: defeated and killed a mass of up to 20,000 rebel soldiers.

Manchu: juwan ninggun-i dobori hūlha burulafi. fargame amcafi ambula waha.
English: when the rebels fled on the night of the sixteenth, we pursued them capturing and killing many.

Manchu: sufan duin. tu kiru. poo. miyoocan. ambula baha seme wesimbuhe:
English: reported we had captured four elephants, and standards, flags, cannon, and muskets in great quantity.

Manchu: orin nadan de feyelehe. nimere janggin cooha be. jiyangiyūn gosime nan ning de unggirede holtome genehengge umesi labdu.
English: On the twenty-seventh, when the general mercifully sent the wounded and sick officers and soldiers to Nanning, there were a great number who went back by pretending.

Manchu: ninggun biyai ice juwe de.
English: On the second day of the sixth month,

Manchu: jiyangiyūn manggitu cooha be gaifi jortai elhememe. inenggidari damu gūsin ba yabume. ša moo san be dulefi tataha .
English: General Manggitu at the head of the army deliberately slowed the march, advancing only 30 li per day, and set up the encampment after crossing the Shamao Mountain.

Manchu: kemungge cin wang-ni cooha be loo r'ung hiyan de isinaha seme boolaha.
English: A report arrived that the soldiers of the Frugal Prince of the Blood had reached Luorong county.

Manchu: ice ilan de da kiyoo de tatafi.
English: On the third we set up camp at Da Qiao.

Manchu: šang ban hiyang ni tusy dahame jifi. li gašan-i tusy be hūlha de dayafi bihe seme alafi.
English: When the chieftain of Shangban village came to surrender, he reported that the chief of Li village had associated himself with the rebels.

Manchu: niowanggiyan tube unggifi. poo simdame efulebuhe.
English: dispatched Green Standard troops, who bombarded with cannon and destroyed it.

Manchu: juwe inenggi indehede. kubuhe šanggiyan-i bayara emken beye kūwalapi. guwan mafa wasinjiha seme.
English: We were resting for a couple of days when the whole body of a bayara guard of the Bordered White changed, and said that the Great Ancestor Guan had descended.

Manchu: jiyangiyūn manggitu genefi. hengkileme turgun be fonjiha.
English: General Manggitu came and kneeling to ask the reason
Comment: Corrected the translation from "...and asked the reason for kneeling"

Manchu: bi ere ganio kai sehe.
English: I said that this was really extraordinary.

Manchu: daci jiyangiyūn guwan enduri nirugan be gaifi yabume. inenggidari hengkilembi.
English: Originally, the general carried with him an image of the god Guandi, and prostrated every day.

Manchu: ice ninggun be jurafi. be sa be dulefi.
English: On the sixth we set out and passed Bosa.

Manchu: ice jakūn de giyang geo ci orin bai dubede tataha.
English: On the eighth we set up camp 20 li from Jiangkou.

Manchu: too deng. giyang keo-i siden emu tanggū jakūnju babe yabuha.
English: Between Taodeng and Jiangkou we covered 180 li.

Manchu: ice uyūn de dzungdu gin. tidu jelken giyang keo de isinjiha.
English: On the ninth Governor-general Jin and Provincial Commander-in-Chief Jelken reached Jiangkou.

Manchu: anda wang be hesei ubašambi seme jafara jakade. fejergi cooha samsifi tabcilame. dahabuci jiderakū seme donjifi sesulaha.
English: I was surprised to hear that, since the Anda Prince had been arrested by imperial edict on a charge of rebellion, the troops under his command had scattered and gone plundering and did not obey the order to surrender.

Manchu: juwan de jiyangiyūn manggitu. juwan da funcere amba jabjan be waha.
English: On the tenth General Manggitu killed a large python long over 10 da.

Manchu: guwa hendume. jabjan serengge mang kai. waci jiyangiyūn de ehe sehe.
English: Some people said: “A python is called mang. Evil to the general for killing it.”

Manchu: juwan emude birai dalin de ibefi.
English: On the eleventh we advanced to the bank of the river.

Manchu: juwan juwe de hebešefi. giyang keo-i bakcin-i dalin-i ing-ni hūlha be emu dobori poo sindabuha.
English: On the twelfth, after holding consultations, it was decided that we would bombard for the whole night the rebels’ encampment on the opposite bank from Jiangkou.

Manchu: bi uksilehei fiyanjilaha.
English: I stood ready in the rear guard in full armor.

Manchu: baitakū ofi. jiyangiyūn bira doofi siyang jeo be gaifi. hūlhai i amargi be lashalaki seme hebdeme toktobuha.
English: Since nothing happened, it was decided that the general would cross the river and occupy Xiangzhou in order to cut off the rear route of the bandits.

Manchu: juwan nadan de jakūn gūsa meni meni cuwan dendeme gaifi. sasari doome.
English: On the seventeenth each of the Eight Banners obtained its share of boats and crossed the river all together.

Manchu: mini beye dobon dulin de dooha.
English: I myself crossed in the middle of the night.

Manchu: juwan jakūn de jurafi. tofohon ba yabufi. tataha.
English: Having set out on the eighteenth, we camped after a march of 15 li.

Manchu: giyang keo-i hūlha alime muterakū. lio jeo-i baru burulaha.
English: The bandits in Jiangkou were not able to hold up, and they fled towards Liuzhou.

Manchu: juwan uju de gūsin sunja ba yabufi tataha.
English: On the nineteenth we camped after marching for 35 li.

Manchu: lio jeo-i jyfu dahame jifi. ubašaha hūlha ma ciyang yen-i dahara bithe be. jiyangiyūn de alibuha.
English: The prefect of Liuzhou came to surrender, and presented to the General a letter of submission from the bandit Ma Chengyin.

Manchu: orin de orin sunja ba yabufi.
English: On the twentieth we marched 25 li,

Manchu: siyang jeo de isinafi tuwaci. hūlha aifini burulahabi.
English: reached Xiangzhou. There we realized that the rebels had fled earlier on.

Manchu: irgen be toktobume fafan selgiyehe.
English: We issued regulations to pacify the local people.

Manchu: orin emude jiyangiyūn. ambasa hebešefi. siyang jeo-i giyang be doorede. bi geli dobori dulime dooha.
English: On the twenty-first the general consulted with the high officers, then we crossed the river in Xiangzhou. Once more I crossed it during the night.

Manchu: orin juwede kemungge cin wang-ni unggihe bithede. ubašaha hūlha ma ciyang yen uju fusifi. doron ejehe benjime dahaha. jiyangiyūn manggitu si hūdun hahilame jifi hebešeme toktobuki sehebi.
English: On the twenty-second a document sent by the Frugal Prince of the Blood said: “The rebel Ma Chengyin has shaved his head in submission, and handed over his seal and imperial diploma. General Manggitu, you must come here at once to consult and deliberate.”

Manchu: jiyangiyūn manggitu nimeme ofi. orin de jurafi. elheken emu tanggū gūsin sunja babe yabufi.
English: Because General Manggitu had fallen ill, we set out on the twentieth, but proceeded slowly for 135 li.

Manchu: orin ninggude lio jeo de isinafi.
English: On the twenty-sixth we reached Liuzhou.

Manchu: jiyangiyūn nimeme ofi. wang de acame muteheku.
English: Since the general was ill, he was unable to meet with the prince,

Manchu: hebei ambasa be gajif i hendume. musei cooha yūn nan be gaime dosire be dahame. lio jeo be musei dara ba waka. coohai tere cuwan-i babe gisure sere jakade.hebei ambasa. wang-ni jakade acanafi turgun be alaha.
English: summoned the councilors and said, “If our army is to advance and capture Yunnan, Liuzhou is not a place we should care about. Discuss the matter of the boats to accommodate the soldiers.” Thereupon the councilors met with the Prince and reported on the situation.

Manchu: bi juwe jergi hoton de dosifi tuwaci. wang-ni cooha. poo gaifi tere jakade. ma ciyang yen-i cooha dele fejile hafirame tehebi.
English: I entered the city twice, and found out that, after the troops of the Prince had placed their artillery pieces into position, the soldiers of Ma Chengyin were being been pressed from above and below.

Manchu: dahaha holo jiyangiyūn huwang ming. ye bing jung-ni jergi dehi funcere hafan be wafi. boigon be talafi. hehe juse be hebei ambasa. kūwaran-i dasa de dendefi buhe.
English: Though the false generals Huang Ming and Ye Bingzhong had surrendered, they had been killed together with another forty officers, and their household properties, women, and children had been confiscated and divided up among our councilors and camp commanders.

Manchu: bi donjifi ere icihiyahangge waka kai sehe.
English: I heard this and thought that this was not the way to keep order.

Manchu: nadan biyai ice de jiyangiyūn nimeme ujelefi.
English: On the first day of the seventh month the general’s illness grew worse.

Manchu: dzungdu gin guwang dzu-i emgi cuwan tefi. duin tanggū manju cooha be gaifi. muke be juraka.
English: Staying in the same boat as Governor-general Jin Guangzu, he set off by river route with 400 Manchu soldiers.

Manchu: ice juwede hife. lebei. ehene se amba cooha be gaifi. olhon be jurafi.
English: On the second, Hife, Lebei, and Ehene at the head of the greater part of the army set out by land.

Manchu: ice jakūn de lai bin hiyan-i sohon turanggi bira de doore de. tuwahai gulu suwayan-i emu cuwan ubaliyafi. gūsin funcere bayara. uksin kutule mukede tuhefi bucehe.
English: On the eighth, while crossing the Sohon Turanggi River in Lai Bin County, a boat of the Plain Yellow Banner capsized and over thirty bayara guards, armored soldiers, and servants fell into the water and drowned.
Comment: Added missing translation

Manchu: juwe inenggi indefi giran baibuha.
English: We rested for two days and recovered the .

Manchu: juwan emude jurafi too deng be dulerede tuwaci. ing kūwaran keremu an-i bi.
English: On the eleventh we set out and, as we passed Taodeng, we saw that the encampment and camp walls were still there.

Manchu: bin jeo de bele gaifi. kun luwan guwan be tucifi.
English: We got food in Binzhou, and then went through the Kunlun Pass.

Manchu: juwan duin de nan ning fude isinaha.
English: On the fourteenth we reached the Prefectural City of Nanning.

Manchu: lin jeo. nan ning fui siden sunja tanggū orin ba be yabuha.
English: Between Liuzhou and Nanning we had covered 520 li.

Manchu: orin jakūnde jiyangiyūn ufarafi acanahade. jakūn gūsai kutule ci wesihun. niowanggiyan tu. irgen gemu gasarakūngge akū.
English: On the twenty-eighth the general passed away. At his funeral, from the servants to the higher ranks of the Eight Banners, to the Green Standard soldiers, and to the common people, there was no one who did not grieve.

Manchu: giran benerede niyalma tugi gese isafi.
English: When [his] remains were sent off, the people gathered like clouds,

Manchu: irgen se hoošan jiha dejime. doose. hošang inu songgoho. ging hūlaha.
English: the civilians burned paper money, and even the Taoist priests and monks wept and read scriptures aloud.
Comment: Added missing translation of irgen

Manchu: jakūn biyai dolo hoošan. baši. šota emu siran-i ufaraha.
English: In the eighth month Hoošan, Baši, and Šota died one after another.

Manchu: mini kutule damu bayartu. manca. hondai. huijeo. maitu funcehebi.
English: Only my servants Bayartu, Manca, Hondai, Huijeo, and Maitu remained.

Manchu: morin orin funcehe bucehe.
English: Over twenty horses died.

Manchu: bi ambula ališame yaburede kutule hibcan. morin akū ainara seme. jibehun-i dolo akame songgombi.
English: I was greatly distressed, and thought, “How am I going to go on now that the servants are few and I have no horses?” I wept in sorrow under the blanket.

Manchu: umai araha akū ofi. bi inenggidari omimbi. hehe be inu uncafi morin udaha.
English: Since there was absolutely nothing that could be done I drank every day and even sold a woman to buy horses.

Manchu: orin de gūsai ejen hife. jiha efire. arki nure omire. loho asharakū oci. nambuha be tuwame weile arambi seme fafulaha.
English: On the twentieth, Lieutenant-general Hife issued an order that those caught in gambling, drinking alcohol, and not wearing swords, would be punished.
Comment: Change eifire to efire; corrected the translation (jiha efire - gambling. not spending money)

Manchu: anagan-i jakūn biyai ice de.
English: On the first day of the eighth intercalary month,

Manchu: hife se hebe acafi. jiyangiyūn geli ufaraha. cooha mohoho turgun be wesimbuki seme gisurefi.
English: Hife and others held a meeting to report to the emperor that the general had died and that the troops were exhausted.

Manchu: yūn nan be gaime dosici. coohai morin wajifi. sonjoci arkan emu nirui sunjata ton-i cooha be bahambi seme wesimbuhe.
English: They also memorialized that if they were to advance and take Yunnan, once all the army’s horses had been used up, one would scarcely manage to select five soldiers out of each company.

Manchu: juwan emude beging-ni hoton de ambarame na aššaha. ambula hiya seme donjifi.
English: On the eleventh we heard of a big earthquake in the city of Beijing, and of a great drought.

Manchu: bi ambula tuksitehe.
English: I became very worried.

Manchu: juwan ilan de nan ning-ni hoton-i dorgi tuwa dafi. guwali inu tuwa daha.
English: On the thirteenth there was a fire inside Nanning city that extended even to the suburbs.

Manchu: orin de jurgan-i unggihe bithede. gūsai ejen lebei be jiyangiyūn sindaha sehebi.
English: On the twentieth, in a document sent by the Ministry, it was said that Lieutenant-general Lebei was to be appointed as our new Field Marshal.

Manchu: gūwa hendume juken sehe:
English: The others said it was just right.

Manchu: orin jakūn de jalan-i janggin fulu seme mimbe nakabuha.
English: On the twenty-eighth, because there were too many colonels, I was discharged from that post.

Manchu: uyūn biyai ice de ganduhai buyarame morin be tolome orho liyoo gaimbi seme.
English: On the first day of the ninth month Ganduhai petty-mindedly decided that people would receive fodder on the basis of the number of horses.

Manchu: janggin cooha morin be baicafi ekiyefi. uncehen tolome orho liyoo gaibure jakade. geren gemu ambula tooha.
English: After officers and soldiers checked the number of horses which had decreased. Because [Ganduhai] then allotted fodder on the basis of the number of tails, everybody was scolding vehemently.
Comment: Corrected the translation to better align with the Manchu context

Manchu: ice ninggude yūn nan be gaime dosi seme hacihiyara bithe isinjifi selgiyefi.
English: On the sixth an urgent dispatch arrived ordering that we invade and conquer Yunnan.

Manchu: janggin cooha be tucibure de. meiren-i janggin masitai mimbe morin kutule hibcan seme tucibuheku.
English: When officers and soldiers were about to set out, Brigadier-general Masitai did not send me because my horses and servants were so few.

Manchu: barkan age. gioroi afan. ganduhai baru gisurefi mimbe murime tucibuhe.
English: Baikan Age and Gioro Afan talked to Ganduhai, insisting sending me out.
Comment: Corrected translation to better align the Manchu context

Manchu: juwan biyai juwan de.
English: On the tenth of the tenth month,

Manchu: jurgan ci unggihe bithede. gūsai ejen laita be julergi be dailara amba jiyangiyūn obufi. yūn nan be gaime dosikini sehebi.
English: in a document sent from the Ministry, it was said that Lieutenant-general Laita had become Field Marshal to Wage War to the South, and was now to invade and conquer Yunnan.

Manchu: juwan emude beging-ni cooha. nan ning de jime. gūsai ejen maci bargiyahakū ofi usame isinjiha.
English: On the eleventh the Beijing troops reached Nanning, but were disappointed because Lieutenant-general Maci did not go out to receive them when they arrived.
Comment: Corrected miswritten useme to usame

Manchu: Juwan nadan de gūsai ejen joo liyan amargi meyen-i cooha be baksan banjibufi yabume.
English: On the seventeenth Lieutenant-general Zhao Lian ordered that the rear-guard troops continue to march divided up into squads.

Manchu: nan ning be dosire be tuwaci. ambula horonggo ofi geren gemu saimaha.
English: When we saw them enter Nanning, everyone praised them for their imposing appearance.

Manchu: oššon biyai ice sunja de.
English: On the fifth of the eleventh month,

Manchu: hesei takūraha dailara cooha be tuwame jurambure ashan-i da ekuri. julergi be dailara amba jiyangiyūn laita gemu nan ning de isinjifi.
English: Imperially appointed to supervise the expeditionary army Sub-Chancellor of the Grand Secretariat Ekuri and Field Marshal to Wage War to the South Laita reached Nanning.

Manchu: uheri cooha be ilan meyen banjibufi.
English: They divided the whole army into three squadrons

Manchu: tofohonde hife. araha meiren-i janggin herbu uju meyen be gaifi jurambi.
English: On the 15th Hife and Commissioned Brigadier-general Herbu will set out at the head of the first squadron.

Manchu: juwan jakūn de gūsai ejen maci.meiren-i janggin hungsilu. ujen cooha-i gūsai ejen joo liyan jai meyen be gaifi jurambi.
English: On the 18th Lieutenant-general Maci, Brigadier-general Hong Shilu, and Lieutenant-general of the Hanjun Zhao Lian will set out at the head of the second squadron.

Manchu: orin ilan de amba jiyangiyūn laita. gūsai ejen lebei. tui janggin ehene. meiren-i janggin masitai. ujen coohai meiren-i janggin dzu jy cun ilaci meyen be gaifi. yūn nan be gaime jurambi.
English: On the 23rd Field Marshal Laita, Lieutenant-general Lebei, Major-general of the Guards Ehene, Brigadier-general Masitai, and Brigadier-general of the Hanjun Zu Zhichun, at the head of the third squadron will set out to take Yunnan.

Manchu: geren cooha gemu ihan emke juwe udaha.
English: All the soldiers bought one or two cows.

Manchu: ihan orin yan. morin ninju. nadanju yan de uncambi.
English: Cattle were sold at 20 ounces per head, and horses at sixty or seventy.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn. janggisa be yooni isabufi faššame yabuki serengge tuci seme fonjiha.
English: The Field Marshal gathered the officers, and asked that those willing to struggle on step forward.

Manchu: geren le la seme. bi bi gemu hoton. hiyahan be ucaraci fekumbi seme. kar mir seme jabumbi.
English: All answered in one loud voice: “Each and every one of us will leap forward whenever we meet city walls and battlements.”

Manchu: mini morin damu duin funcefi.
English: I only had four horses left.

Manchu: duin tanggū yan de duin morin. ninggun ihan udaha.
English: With 400 ounces of silver I bought four horses and six head of cattle.

Manchu: kutule morin umesi hibcan ofi. ambula ališame joboho.
English: Because horses and servants were so few, I was worried and distressed.

Manchu: ice sunja-i dobori wargi ci tucike usiha. šanggiyan sukdun sumakangge orin da funcembi.
English: On the night of the fifth a star appeared in the west; it had a white mist that spread across an area of over 20 da.

Manchu: arbun loho-i adali. da-i ergi fulahūn sabumbi.
English: One could see that in shape it resembled a sword, and it was red at the base.

Manchu: niyalma tome diyan-i baru dosici ehe seme gisurehe.
English: Everyone said that if it advanced towards the imperial palace it would be a bad omen.

Manchu: tere yūn nan be toktobure todolo bihebi.
English: this was an auspicious sign for the pacification of Yunnan.

Manchu: nan ning de gūsa tome janggin juwe. tulergi monggo cooha be dabume morin akū sakda. nimekungge emu nirui juwete uksin be werirede. bi yeremu. handu sei jergi juwan ilan uksin be werihe.
English: Since two officers from each banner and, in addition to the Outer Mongol troops, two armored soldiers from each company who were without horses, old, or sick were to be left in Nanning, I, Yeremu, Handu, and the others left thirteen armored soldiers.

Manchu: ganduhai mimbe uju meyen de banjibuha.
English: Ganduhai made me join the first squadron.

Manchu: tofohon de gūsai ejen hife se uju meyen-i ilata bayara. sunjata aliha cooha be gaifi. nan ning ci jurafi.
English: On the fifteenth Lieutenant-general Hife and the others, leading the first squadron, which was formed by three bayara guards and five cavalrymen [out of each company], left Nanning,

Manchu: orin ba yabufi tataha.
English: after a march of 20 li set up camp.

Manchu: minde kutule morin komso ofi. munahūn-i jurafi. damu dain de buceki seme gunime. gebu gaiki sembi.
English: Because I only had a few servants and horses left, I departed in a surly mood, and could only think that I would die in battle, and gain honor.

Manchu: u yuwan hiyan-i sunja ba golmin alin-i angga de yarubufi.
English: We were led into a 5 li long mountain pass in Wuyuan county.

Manchu: cibume juwe dobori dulifi.
English: we squeezed through it for two nights.

Manchu: juwan nadan de teni angga be tucike.
English: On the seventeenth we finally came out of the mountain pass.

Manchu: u yuwan hiyan be dulefi. dobori dulihai alin-i angga. alin-i jidun-i narhūn jugun be mudakiyame jodome yarubufi .
English: Having past Wuyuan county, then we were led in a meandering manner, stopping and going, on a narrow path through mountain passes and along the back of the mountain.

Manchu: ninggun tanggū babe juwan duin inenggi. dobori dulime yabufi.
English: Proceeding at night we covered 600 li in fourteen days.

Manchu: orin jakūn de
English: On the twenty-eighth,

Manchu: tiyan jeo de isinafi tuwaci. hūlha burulahabi.
English: when we reached Tianzhou, we realized that the bandits had already fled.

Manchu: jen yuwan. gui jeo be baha seme donjiha.
English: We heard that Zhenyuan and Guizhou had been taken.

Manchu: orin uyūnde orin bai na biyoo de tataha.
English: On the twenty-ninth we marched for 20 li and set up camp at Nabiao.

Manchu: gūsin de gūsin bai je ma de tataha.
English: On the thirtieth we set up camp 30 li further on, at Zhaima.

Manchu: gui loo bade hūlha bi seme selgiyefi. dobori uksilehei jucelehe.
English: It was announced that there were bandits in Guiluo, so at night we mounted guard wearing armor.

Manchu: jorgon biyai ice de uksilef i orin ba yabufi. ju jio tang de tataha.
English: On the first day of the twelfth month we marched in full armor and set up camp in Zhujiutang.

Manchu: gui loo-i hūlha burulahabi.
English: The rebels of Guiluo had fled.

Manchu: ice juwe de hife se handu baifi. dehi inenggi jetere bele niohume gaisu. amba jiyangiyūn be aliyame indembi seme selgiyehe.
English: On the second Hife and others issued the following order: “Search for unhusked rice, and obtain and pound rice for forty days; then rest and wait for the Field Marshal.”

Manchu: kūwaran-i tome yooni heliyen congkišakū arafi. eye feteme handu baifi bele niohumbi.
English: Everyone in the encampment was making pounders and pestles, digging holes, and looking for unhusked rice to pound into husked rice.

Manchu: ice duide amba jiyangiyūn aliya seme bithe unggihe.
English: On the fourth the Field Marshal sent a dispatch ordering to wait.

Manchu: ice sunja de tusy-i da mu wang dahaha.
English: On the fifth the leader of local chiefs Muwang surrendered.

Manchu: nenehe jiyangiyūn manggitu-ni unggihe jiyansi jifi. tiye so kiyoo de hūlha tuwa sindafi burulaha. musei tidu sangge lu šui giyang be dooha seme alambi.
English: Spies previously sent by General Manggitu came back and reported that the rebels had fled after setting the Tiesuo bridge on fire, and our Provincial Military Commander Sangge had crossed the Lushui river.

Manchu: hebei amban. kūwaran da. tui bayara janggin se acafi hebdefi. meni cooha damu sunja inenggi bele arame bahambi. jai sunja inenggi bele bufi. eici dosire. amba jiyangiyūn be aliyara babe. amba jiyangiyūn-i gisun be dahame yabuki seme bithe alibuha.
English:
The councilors, camp commanders, and the major-generals of the Guards met to deliberate, and thereafter submitted the following written report:                                
Our troops have obtained provisions for five days only. If [you] provide them with food for another five days, then we shall follow the Field Marshal’s order as to whether we should set out or wait here for the Field Marshal.

Manchu: ice ninggude. amba jiyangiyūn-i unggihe bithede.
English: On the sixth, in a document sent by the Field Marshal

Manchu: gui jeo be alibume tidu libenšen.siyun fu dzoo šen gi dahaha:ne suwende juwan cuwan-i bele unggihe.mimbe aliya sehebi.
English: it said: “Provincial Commander Li Benshen80 and Provincial Governor Cao Shenji have surrendered, giving up Guizhou. Now, I have dispatched ten boats to you with rice. Wait for me.”

Manchu: je ma tang-ni bade juwan emu inenggi indehe.
English: We rested in Zhaimadang for eleven days.

Manchu: juwan juwede dosi sere bithe isinjifi jurafi.
English: On the twelfth we received a written order to advance, and set out.

Manchu: jugun hafirahūn alin-i holo isheliyen. handu cyse lifakū ofi. akame jobome. morin-i aciha tuheme lifame.
English: Because the road was a cramped pass in a narrow mountain ravine, and because of the swampy rice fields, the march was extremely hard and distressing and the horses’ loads fell off or got stuck.

Manchu: jakūn dobori dulime. juwe tanggū uyūnju babe yabuha.
English: We proceeded for eight nights, covering 290 li.

Manchu: juwan uyūn de ba du ho bira muke de ehe sukdun bi. ume jetere seme selgiyehe.
English: On the nineteenth we were ordered not to drink the water of the Badu river because there was a bad smell.

Manchu: hife sei unggihe emu bithe de. janggin-i beye de afabume. amba jiyangiyūn de benebu sehebi.
English: A document was sent by Hife and others, which ordered that it should be entrusted to the officers to be delivered in person to the Field Marshal.
Comment: Corrected the translation

Manchu: musei gūsa de isinjifi. ganduhai minde bufi benehe.
English: After this document reached our Banner Ganduhai handed it over to me and I delivered it.
Comment: Corrected the translation

Manchu: orin de yan yang tang ci jurafi. bujan-i dorgi be yabume. šun be saburakū.
English: On the twentieth we set out from Yanyangtang and marched through a forest where sunlight could not be seen.

Manchu: tofohon bai dubede yarume tataha.
English: After marching in close order for 15 li we set up camp.

Manchu: orin emude gūsin sunja ba yabufi. si lung jeo de isinaf i tataha.
English: On the twenty-first we marched for 35 li, reached Xilongzhou and set up camp.

Manchu: tiyan jeo. si lung jeo-i siden ilan tanggū jakūnju ba funcembi.
English: The distance between Tianzhou and Xilongzhou exceeds 380 li.

Manchu: si lung jeo efujefi hoton akū. susu-i muru bi.
English: After Xilongzhou was captured, no walls were left and the place had a barren and desolate appearance.

Manchu: lung tu guwan dahafi. ba nai tusy sunja tanggū okdome jifi.
English: Longtukuan surrendered, and 500 native chiefs came to welcome.

Manchu: fukiyoo cabume. muse moo sacifi buhe.
English: We chopped wood and gave it to them to build a pontoon bridge.

Manchu: orin juwede amba jiyangiyūn hebei ambasa be isabufi. hebešefi fukiyoo manggame juraki.
English: On the twenty-second the Field Marshal met with the councilors, and decided to set out as soon as the pontoon bridge had been completed.

Manchu: niowanggiyan tu be juleri. sirame sonjoho uju meyen-i gabsihiyan. emu nirui ilata bayara. ilata aliha cooha be yabubuki. gemu orin sime bufi. hebei amban lebei. hife. ehene se gaifi. orin ninggude jurakini.
English: Put the Green Standard troops in front, followed by a select first squadron with the Vanguard Regiment and three guards and three cavalrymen from each company, and be given a full complement of horses. Under the command of Councilors Lebei, Hife, and Ehene, it shall shall set out on the 26th.

Manchu: sonjoho jai meyen-i juwete bayara. ilata aliha cooha de gemu morin sime bufi. amba jiyangiyūn. hebei amban maci. hungsilu. herbu. joo liyan se gaif i amala jurambi.
English: A select second squadron, composed of two guards and three cavalrymen from each company, with a full complement of horses, led by the Field Marshal and by Councilors Maci, Hong Shilu, Herbu, Zhao Lian, and others, shall set out soon afterwards.

Manchu: nukte meyen de. gala de juwete kūwaran-i da. gūsa tome nadan janggin. emu nirui ilata moorin akū cooha de. ihan sime bufi.
English: The baggage column and the wing squadrons should be composed of two camp commanders and seven captains from each banner, and by three soldiers without horses from each company, and must be provided with cattle.

Manchu: golo hoton-i sunja tanggū morin akū cooha de. inu ihan sime bufi.
English: 500 infantry soldiers from the provincial capital must also be provided with cattle.

Manchu: amala elhe yabukini.
English: These shall march behind at a slower pace.

Manchu: dzungdu gin guwang dzu ini harangga niowanggiyan tu be gaifi. uncehen be fiyamjilakini
English: All the Green Standard troops under the direct command of Governor-general Jin Guangzu shall serve as rearguard.

Manchu: ganduhai. mimbe jai meyen de banjibuha.
English: Ganduhai made me join the second squadron.

Manchu: orin ninggude uju meyen-i cooha juraka.
English: On the twenty-sixth the troops of the first squadron left.

Manchu: elhe taif in-i šahūn coko orici aniya.
English: On New Year’s Day of the twentieth year of Kangxi,

Manchu: aniyai ice inenggi si lung jeo ci jurafi. fukiyoo be doofi.
English: year of the White-Gray Rooster, we left Xilongzhou, and passed the pontoon bridge.

Manchu: ba di ho bira be tuwaci. muke niowanggiyan bime. eyen turgen. alin birai cikin-i jugun juwe cy isimbi.
English: One could see that the river water looked greenish, the current was fast, and the track on the bank of the river, along the mountainside, was only two feet wide.

Manchu: cooha morin yarubufi cibume. ilihai juwan ba yabuhakū yamjifi.
English: Soldiers and horses were all pressed one against the other. We had not proceeded 10 li when it became dark.

Manchu: tatara ba baharakū ofi. birai dan-i yonggan de tatafi .
English: Because it was impossible to find a place to camp, we pitched our tents in the sand on a bend of the river.

Manchu: edun de yonggan furgime. muke nure udu gin. ulgiyan emke udafi aniya araha.
English: The sand was being lifted up in the wind. We bought a few pints of water and spirits, and one pig to celebrate the New Year.

Manchu: bi dolori akame ureme damu sakdasa be kidume gūnime. jibehun-i dolo songgoho.
English: In my heart I felt sad and disconsolate and, longing for my old people, I wept under the blanket.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn jugun narhūn. ing ilire ba akū. siran siran-i acara be tuwame ili seme selgiyehe.
English: The Field Marshal issued an order: “The road is narrow; there is no place to set up the encampment. Pitch the tents one after the other as you see fit.”

Manchu: bai irgen be gajif i fonjici.
English: We brought in some local people and questioned them.

Manchu: julgeci ebsi cooha yabuha jugun waka. hangsi ci amasi. tojin. meihe. beten bira de jalufi. bira duranggi ofi. muke bisakade. jugun uribufi. niyalma yabuci ojorakū.
English: Since ancient times there has never been a road for a marching army. After the hangsi festival, peacocks, snakes, and worms fill the river. Because the river is muddy, when the water overflows the road becomes submerged and people cannot get through.

Manchu: ehe sukdun de goici bucembi. tuttu of i meni boo be alin-i ninggude arahabi.
English: If they are struck by foul vapors, they will die. Therefore we build our houses on the top of the mountain.

Manchu: tuwaci mukei hirgen moo-i subehe de. aššan kemuni takahabi.
English: Upon observation, one could often detect movements on the riverbed and in the branches of trees.

Manchu: jai inenggi jurafi ilihai yamjime. emu juwe maikan arara bade yarume tatame.
English: On the next day we departed and, as soon as night started to fall, we filed into a place where only one or two tents could stand, and set up camp.

Manchu: ice ilan de ši men k’an-i hūlha be gidaha seme donjiha.
English: On the third we heard that the rebels at Shimen Ridge had been defeated.

Manchu: ice jakūn de teni ban dun teng de isinafi tatafi.
English: Not until the eighth we reached and set camp at Bandunteng.

Manchu: ši men k’an de cibufi jakūn inenggi indehe.
English: Squeezed tight, we stopped at Shimen Ridge for eight days.

Manchu: jugun de orho sekteme yabu seme selgiyehe.
English: Then we were ordered to cover the road with grass when marching.

Manchu: tofohon de jurafi.
English: On the fifteenth we set out again

Manchu: ser seme bonome agara jakade. tofohon ba dabagan-i narhūn jugun be yafahan šaban huwaitafi yabume. ši men k’an-i fejile tataha.
English: because it was raining and hailing lightly, we strapped leather and iron cleats and walked on foot on the narrow mountain road for 15 li, and set up camp at the foot of Shimen Ridge.

Manchu: juwan ninggude ši men k’an-i uju terkin be micume tafame.
English: On the sixteenth crawling and slipping along the way, we climbed up to the first level of Shimen Ridge.

Manchu: kanggarame niolmon. orho sektefi. morin be emke emken-i ganame arkan seme lifakū ehe babe dulerede.
English: We spread grass on the slippery moss, and fetching the horses one by one, we crossed with great effort that swampy and hideous place.

Manchu: tuwaci gulakū de morin fuhemefi labdu bucehebi.
English: One could see that many horses had fallen into the precipice and died.

Manchu: niyalmai bethe yooni fukanafi yabuci ojorakū.
English: The men’s feet were covered with blisters, and could not go any further.

Manchu: ilan ba yabufi farhun oho.
English: After we had walked for 3 li it was getting dark.

Manchu: tuheme afame arkan jai k’an-i wehe terkin be dulefi tataha.
English: Staggering and stumbling, we struggled on crossing over the rock layer of the second ridge, and set up camp.

Manchu: tuwaci waha hūlha emke emken-i bi.
English: One could see one by one the bodies of the rebels who had been killed.

Manchu: juwan nadan de yafahan orin ba yabufi.
English: On the seventeenth we marched 20 li on foot.

Manchu: bethe nimeme. arkan seme ilaci k’an-i terkin edulefi. morilaci ome selafi.
English: With aching feet we struggled to cross over the third level ridge, where we rejoiced for being able to ride horses.

Manchu: geneme an lung so de isinafi.
English: So we proceeded until we reached Anlongsuo.

Manchu: tuwaci hūlha dahafi irgen-i hehe juse be hoton-i baru gajime jimbi
English: One could see that the rebels who had surrendered were coming towards the city taking the common people’s women and children.

Manchu: bi teni toktoho ba seme. bakcilaha kūwaran-i da hose-i baru gisurefi.
English: I thought that was just the right place to stop, and said so to Hose, who is the head of the encampment that faces mine.

Manchu: hoton be dulefi tataha.
English: We set up camp after we passed the city.

Manchu: si lung jeo ci an lung so-i siden ehe jugun juwe tanggū orin sunja ba funcembi.
English: Between Xilongzhou and Anlongsuo there are over 225 li of awful road.

Manchu: juwan jakūn de jurafi.
English: On the eighteenth we set out.

Manchu: tuwaci ba šehun onco.
English: The area appeared wide and barren.

Manchu: julergi meyen be amcame dobori dulime ninju ba yabuha.
English: We joined up with the squadron in front and, marching all night, we covered 60 li.

Manchu: juwan uyūn de indefi selgiyefi ilan meyen banjiburede.
English: On the nineteenth we rested. An order was issued that we form three

Manchu: ganduhai.mimbe uju meyen de banjibuha.
English: Ganduhai assigned me to the first squadron.

Manchu: orin emude amba jiyangiyūn kubuhe lamun dobori dulime joboho seme.
English: On the twenty-first the Field Marshal said that the Bordered Blue Banner would have to endure an overnight march.

Manchu: gajartai nikan emke bufi. juwe inengg dokolome jakūnju ba yabuha.
English: We were given a Chinese guide, and in two days we covered 80 li taking shortcuts.

Manchu: orin ilande ma biye ho bira be fukiyoo came indehe.
English: On the twenty-third we built a pontoon bridge on the Mabie River and rested.

Manchu: hūlha huwang dzoo ba de ing ilifi. alime gaihabi seme donjiha
English: We heard that the rebels were camped at Huangcaoba, and ready to resist.

Manchu: orin ninggude fukiyoo šanggafi.
English: On the twenty-sixth the bridge was completed

Manchu: uheri nukte de emu nirui emte morin akū cooha be werifi. cimari gemu uksilefi bira doombi seme selgiyehe.
English: we were ordered to leave one soldier without horse from each company with the entire baggage train, and to cross the river on the next day wearing armor.

Manchu: orin nadan de amba jiyangiyūn amba cooha be gaifi. bira be doofi.
English: On the twenty-seventh the Field Marshal crossed the river with the whole army

Manchu: šehun babe gūsin ba yabufi hūlhai ing de nikenefi.
English: after a march of 30 li over a barren territory we approached the rebels’ encampment.

Manchu: tuwaci lifakū handu cyse. alin be gaime. keremu ulan arafi ing ilihabi.
English: One could see the swamp-like rice paddies. An encampment has been set up against the mountain, and protected with ramparts and moats.

Manchu: ba ambula ehe. afaci ojorakū ofi. uthai cooha be gocika.
English: That place was a really wicked one, and could not be attacked. Therefore the general withdrew the army.

Manchu: ging hecen ci giyamun ilibume jihe icihiyara hafan walda se isinjifi .
English: Departmental Director Walda and others, who had come from the capital to build relay stations, arrived

Manchu: dergici. hafan coohai sain be fonjiha.
English: An imperial dispatch, in which the emperor inquired about the well-being of officers and soldiers.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn geren be gaifi. aniya doroi hengkilehe.
English: The Field Marshal, leading everyone else, prostrated himself in accordance with the New Year’s rites.

Manchu: orin jakūn de ma biye ho bira be doofi. sunja ba yabufi ing ilifi. yooni uksilehei jucelehe.
English: On the twenty-eighth we crossed the Mabie River and, after a 5-li march set up camp, mounting guard in full armor.

Manchu: orin uyūnde amba jiyangiyūn amba cooha be gaifi. faidafi ibeme.
English: On the twenty-ninth the Field Marshal arranged the army in rows and advanced.

Manchu: alin bigan be sektefi. orin sunja ba yabufi. afara arame. hūlhai ing be fehufi kimcime.
English: We went through the mountain and the wilderness, and after a march of 25 li, feigning an attack, we closed in on the rebels’ camp.

Manchu: tuwaci cin-i dere be afaci ojorakū.
English: We realized that it was impossible to attack it frontally.

Manchu: fiyanjilafi akdulame bakcilame ing iliha.
English: We came to the rear, and made fortifications and set up our camp in front of it.

Manchu: juwe biyai ice de. uheri cooha be baksan baksan jergi jergi faidabufi.
English: On the first day of the second month the whole army was ordered to line up by units and ranks.

Manchu: ibefi afara babe toktobume tuwaha.
English: We advanced, and tried to decide the place we were going to attack.

Manchu: musei coohai hūsun ambula etuhun.
English: Our troops are mighty and powerful.

Manchu: ice juwe de
English: On the second

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn.ing be tuwakiyara duin tanggū manju cooha. emu minggan niowanggiyan tu cooha be yarkiyabume. cin-i dere de bakcilabufi.
English: the Field Marshal ordered 400 Manchu soldiers and 1000 Green Standard soldiers who were mounting guard at the camp to make a frontal attack as a decoy.

Manchu: makmaha meyen de hebei amban ehene. maci. uju meyen de hebei amban hife. hungsilu. herbu. meiren-i janggin masitai. ujen coohai dzu jy cun. jai meyen de gūsai ejen lebei. ujen coohai joo liyan sede cooha be afabufi .
English: Then he ordered Councilors Ehene and Maci to lead the wing squadron; Councilors Hife, Hong Shilu, Herbu, Lieutenant-general Masitai, and Zu Zhichun, of the Hanjun, to lead the first squadron; and Lieutenant-general Lebei and Zhao Lian, of the Hanjun, to lead the second squadron.

Manchu: niowanggiyan tu be juleri. manju cooha be amala duin ursu faidabufi.
English: He also ordered the Green Standard troops to line up in front, and the Manchu troops in the rear, arranged in four echelons.

Manchu: kalka gida jafabufi. hūlhai ing ni amargi narhūn alin-i jugun be gaime iberede.
English: Holding shields and spears [we] advanced along a narrow mountain road behind the enemy camp.

Manchu: gaitai talman talmafi hanci niyalma be ishunde saburakū.
English: Suddenly a thick fog rose and even men [standing] close-by could not see one another.

Manchu: alin-i angga de hūlha belheheku.
English: The rebels at the entrance of the mountain pass were not ready.

Manchu: musei cooha dosifi. poo jilgan be lakcarakū donjimbi.
English: Our troops advanced, and we could hear the inces- sant sound of artillery.

Manchu: musei gamaha kalka be waliyahangge jugun de hihahabi.
English: Shields that had been abandoned by our troops could be seen everywhere on the road.

Manchu: bi tu be gaifi feksime genefi. alin-i anggai dolo dosifi. tuwaci hūlha ingci tucifi. hiyahan. kalka. sufan be faidafi. musei niowanggiyan tu baru afambi.
English: Carrying a flag I ran forward, entered the mountain pass, and saw rebels who, had come out of the encampment, lined up chevaux-de-frise, shields and elephants, and joined battle with our Green Standard troops.

Manchu: poo miyoocan-i jilgan turi tashara adali. na durgembi.
English: The fire from cannon and muskets sounded like frying beans, the earth was shaking.

Manchu: musei niowanggiyan tu šahuri feye bahafi. emu jergi aššafi tomsoho.
English: Šahuri, a man of the Green Standard, received a wound, but got up once again.

Manchu: musei uju meyen. šakšaha meyen kaicame dosirede.
English: Our first and wing squadrons advanced yelling.

Manchu: na ujelere gese.
English: It was as if the earth itself was falling down.

Manchu: hūlha alime muterakū. gidabufi burulara de.
English: The enemy could not hold their ground and, been overwhelmed, started to flee.

Manchu: bi tu be gaifi. wame alin-i ing de nikename.
English: I was carrying a flag and, killing, came closer to the camp on the mountain side.

Manchu: ing-ni hūlha keremu sangga ci miyoocan sindambi.
English: The rebels in the camp were firing their muskets from holes in the ramparts.

Manchu: ebšeme alin ci wasifi. moringga hūlha be sunja ba fungeme bošome waha.
English: Hurrying down the mountain slope I pursued and killed mounted rebels for 5 li.

Manchu: cooha be bargiyafi bederere de. tuwaci giran hetu undu bigan de sektefi.
English: When the troops were recalled and returned to the camp, one could see corpses covering that wilderness in all directions.

Manchu: senggi nade eyembi.
English: Blood was flowing on the ground.

Manchu: ing de poo miyoocan agura hajun ehe sain jaka be hiyahame waliyahabi.
English: In the camp cannons and rifles, whether in good or bad condition, had been abandoned all over the place.

Manchu: sufan sunja baha.
English: We captured five elephants.

Manchu: jafaha hūlhai jiyangiyūn wang io gung. an yang de fonjici. hūlhai holo jiyangiyūn ho gi dzu. wang hung siyun. joo ioi. wang hung gioi. bakimeng jang- guwang siyan. lio mi jen meni uyun nofi. uheri juwe tumen isire hūlha be gaifi. kioi jing fu. loo ping jeo-i oyonggo jugun-i huwang dzoo ba be tuwakiyame bihe seme alambi.
English: When they were interrogated, the captured rebel generals Wang Yougong and Zhan Yang reported that the rebel false generals He Jizu, Wang Hongxun, Zhao Yu, Wang Hongju, Ba Qisheng, Zhang Guangxin, Liu Shizhen, and themselves, nine people in all, at the head of approximately 20,000 soldiers all together, were protecting Huangcaoba, on the strategic road to Loping, in the Qujing Fu.

Manchu: ice ilan de indefi.
English: On the third day we rested.

Manchu: janggin cooha be forgošome meyen banjibure de. ganduhai kemuni mimbe uju meyen de bibuhe.
English: When officers and soldiers were reassigned and squadrons were formed, Ganduhai assigned me again to the first squadron.

Manchu: ice duide dehi ba yabufi. dobori tataha.
English: On the fourth we marched for 40 li, and then set up camp at night.

Manchu: ice sunja de dehi ba yabufi. huwang ni ho bira be dooha.
English: On the fifth we marched 40 li and crossed the Huangni River.

Manchu: ice ninggude dabagan dabame. dobori dulime gūsin ba yabuha.
English: On the sixth we climbed over a mountain ridge and, marching overnight, covered 30 li.

Manchu: ice nadan de amba yūn nan po dabagan be yafahan tafarade
English: On the seventh, as we were climbing on foot the great mountain ridge of Yunnanbao

Manchu: amba edun dame. yonggan buraki de yasa sohime yabuci ojorakū .
English: a formidable wind rose, and because the sand was getting into our eyes, it became impossible to proceed.

Manchu: gūsin ba yabufi. dobori farhun talman talmaka.
English: Having marched 30 li, it got dark for the night, and a heavy fog rose up.

Manchu: ice jakūn de amba edun dame.
English: On the eighth a strong wind blew,

Manchu: buraki de yasa neici ojorakū.
English: it was impossible to open our eyes because of the dust.

Manchu: i dzo hiyan be duleme ninju sunja ba yabuha.
English: We passed Yizuo county covering 60 li.

Manchu: ice uyūn de gūsin ba yabufi. hūwang ho san de ilifi.
English: On the ninth we marched 30 li, then stopped at Huanghe Mountain

Manchu: kioi jing. giyoo sui de mejige gaime. gūsa de emu janggin.orin uksin be tucibu seme selgiyehe.
English: We were ordered to send a Banner officer, together with twenty armored soldiers, out on a mission to gather information in Qujing and Jiaoshui.

Manchu: ganduhai mimbe tucibuhe
English: Ganduhai sent me.

Manchu: juwan de bi uksin sabe gaifi. feksime tanggū ba funceme yabufi. yuwai jeo de isinafi.
English: On the tenth I, at the head of the armored soldiers, rode over 100 li at full gallop, and reached Yuezhou.

Manchu: tuwaci hūlha akū. kioi jing kiyoo ci bederehe.
English: Upon inspection there were no rebels, and returned by way of the Qujing bridge.

Manchu: juwan emude kioi jing giyun min fu-i jyfu coo gui minggan funcere hūlha be gaifi dahaha.
English: On the eleventh Li Chaogui, the Prefect of Minfu in the Qujing Fu, surrendered with 1,000 men.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn cooha be gaifi. kioi jing be duleme. orin ba yabufi tatafi.
English: The Field Marshal, at the head of the army, passed Qujing and camped after a march of 20 li.

Manchu: giyoo sui jeo. yūn nan. gui jeo. sycuwan-i jugun hafunjiha oyonggo hoton seme. dobori meni uju meyen-i cooha be unggihe.
English: Because Jiaoshui is an important city on the routes toYunnan, Guizhou, and Sichuan, he ordered my first squadron’s soldiers to go there at night.

Manchu: orin sunja ba yabufi. giyoo sui de isinaci.
English: After having proceeded for 25 li, we reached Jiaoshui.

Manchu: hūlha aifini burulahabi.
English: The rebels had run away earlier.

Manchu: hoton-i dzang de sunja tumen hule bele bi
English: In the city granaries there were 50,000 hule of rice.

Manchu: bele gaime ilan inenggi indehe.
English: We seized the rice and rested for three days.

Manchu: gui jeo jangtai beisei cooha isinjiha.
English: The Guizhou army of Jangtai Beise arrived.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn meyen forgošome banjibu. duici ging-ni erinde yūn nan be gaime jurambi seme selgiyehe.
English: The Field Marshal issued orders that troops be reassigned and formed into squadron, and that the army moved out on the fourth night watch to take Yunnan.

Manchu: ganduhai mimbe jai meyen banjibuha.
English: Ganduhai assigned me to the second squadron.

Manchu: tofohon-i dobon dulin de jurafi. ma lung jeo be duleme. jakūnju ba yabuha.
English: We set out in the middle of the night of the fifteenth, and, passing Malongzhou, we covered 80 li.

Manchu: beise-i bayara kaidu moringga amcanjiha.
English: A single horseman of Beise’s guards caught up with us.

Manchu: juwan uyūn de hahilame i lung be dulefi.
English: On the sixteenth we hurried through Yilong

Manchu: guwan so ling-ni dabagan be dabame emu tanggū orin ba yabufi. yang lin de isinjiha.
English: climbed over the Guansuoling mountain ridge, and reached Yanglin after having covered 120 li.

Manchu: donjici hūlha šang ban kiyoo de ing iliha bi sembi
English: we heard that the bandits were camped at Shangban Bridge.

Manchu: juwan nadan de amba jiyangiyūn ilan meyen-i cooha be uksilebufi faidafi. ibeme gūsin ba yabufi.
English: On the seventeenth the Field Marshal ordered that the troops of three squadrons line up in formation in full armor and proceed for 30 li.

Manchu: šang ban kiyoo de isinafi tuwaci. hūlha ing be waliyafi burulahabi
English: When [we] reached Shangban Bridge [we] saw that the rebels had abandoned the camp and fled.

Manchu: juwan jakūn de kalka ara. niowanggiyan tu isinjiha manggi. hoton be afambi seme selgiyehe.
English: On the eighteenth an order was issued that said: “Prepare your shields. After the Green Standard troops have arrived attack the city.”

Manchu: juwan uyūn de amba jiyangiyūn ilan meyen-i amba cooha. beise-i cooha be gaifi. elhe ibeme orin ba yabufi. gui huwa sy alin de wesifi. cooha be faidabufi.
English: On the nineteenth the Field Marshal, at the head of both the main army divided into three squadrons and the troops of the Beise, slowly advanced for 20 li, climbed the Guihuasi Mountain, and then lined up the army in formation.

Manchu: tuwaci hoton akdun afaci ojorakū.
English: Looking at it, the city appeared strong and impregnable,

Manchu: cooha be gocifi bedereme. hoton ci nadan bai dubede.
English: withdrew the troops and retreated to a distance of 7 li from the city.

Manchu: alirame ing ilifi. dobori dulime keremu ulan weile seme selgiyefi.
English: set up our encampment along the mountain side, and received orders to make ramparts and moats during the night.

Manchu: bi jalan-i cooha begaifi. dobori keremu sahame. ulan fetehe
English: I, at the head of the regiment’s soldiers, worked overnight erecting ramparts and digging moats.

Manchu: guwangsi goloi nan ning fu.yūn nan-i hoton-i siden juwe minggan tofohon ba funcembi.
English: Between the provincial city of Nanning, in Guangxi province, and the capital of Yunnan, there is a distance of 2015 li.

Manchu: orin emude hūlha dobori yūn nan-i hoton ci tucifi afanjiha.
English: On the twenty-first the rebels made a sortie out of Yunnan city and attacked.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn uheri amba cooha be gaifi. okdome ingci tucifi faidabufi ibeme.
English: The Field Marshal gathered the whole army outside the encampment in battle formation.

Manchu: afara babe tuwafi. šakšiha meyen be ing be fiyanjilabuha.
English: After having examined the battleground, he ordered the wing squadron to protect the rear of the camp.

Manchu: tere uju meyen-i cooha be šakšalame dosi seme joriha. niowanggiyan tu-i cooha be juleri.jai meyen cooha amala cin-i dere be dosi seme joriha.
English: He pointed his finger and ordered the troops of the first squadron to advance as to outflank. Pointing the finger again, he ordered the troops of the Green Standard to line up in front with those of the second squadron behind them, and to advance against the front.

Manchu: uju meyen elemangga hūlhai uncehen be meiteme. hoton-i baru untuhun be baime dosika.
English: The first squadron, moreover, advanced to cut off the tail of the bandits, and to seek an opening towards the city.

Manchu: musei niowanggiyan tu. hūlhai baru afame. poo miyoocan-i jilgan tur seme lakcarakū.
English: When our Green Standard troops charged the enemy, the roaring sound of cannons and muskets was incessant

Manchu: šan ureme ambula goidaha
English: lasted for such a long time that the ears became used to it

Manchu: hūlha emu dulin aššafi. jai emu udu kuren aššarakū teng seme bucetei afambi.
English: Half of the rebels vacillated and fled, but the other half, comprising several squadrons, did not budge, and were resolved to fight to the death.

Manchu: meni jai meyen-i cooha yooni aššaha bata be gidame dosika.
English: The troops of our second squadron attacked those enemies that had already been completely routed.

Manchu: hebei amban hife. kubuhe fulgiyan. musei gūsa be hūlafi. tere aššara unde udu kuren-i kiyoo gašan be ejelehe bata be gida seme joriha
English: Councilor Hife called aloud for the Bordered Red Banner and our own Banner, and ordered: “Crush those rebel detachments that have not been routed and are still in control of the bridge and village.”

Manchu: meni juwe gūsa kaicame afame dosifi. poo. cu niru. paiciyang de hamirakū.
English: Our two Banners yelling went to the assault, but the fire of cannons, fiery arrows, and the volleys of musket was overwhelming.

Manchu: efujehe fu-i dalda de. juwe gūsa emu bade fumerefi bisirede.
English: in hidden spots among the ruined walls, our two Banners became all mingled into one group.

Manchu: bi emhun birai dalin de ilifi. tuwaci musei cooha niyalma emdubei feye bahambi.
English: I reached the bank of the river by myself, and saw that our soldiers were being continuously wounded.

Manchu: hife niyalma takūrafi. yafahan dosi seme
English: Hife sent a man with the order to advance on foot

Manchu: jing sirdan jafara burgin de. hūlhai amargi baksan sumburšambi.
English: as soon as we got within shooting range, the rearguard of the rebels was in disarray.

Manchu: bi uthai tu be gaifi. bira be doofi. hūlhai amargi be sundalame dosirede. hūlha burulaha.
English: I immediately grabbed the flag, and crossed the river, pressing forward in pursuit of the rebels’ rearguard. The rebels fled.

Manchu: bi amcanafi. geren hūlha de daha serede. gemu niyakūrafi. agura waliyafi. ergen be guwebu sembi.
English: As soon as I caught up with them, I told them that they must all surrender. They all knelt down, lay down their weapons and begged me to spare their lives.

Manchu: bayara emu hūlha be gabtara de. gemu ilifi sujuhe.
English: when a bayara guard shot a rebel with an arrow, they all stood up and fled.

Manchu: juwe hūlha. waliyaha jangkū be gaifi. buceki seme sacime dosinjiha.
English: Two rebels got hold of long swords that had been abandoned, and, indifferent to death, came forward slashing.

Manchu: bi ekmeme morin be dabkiyame šusišame. den ekcin de tafaha.
English: Rushing off, I whipped the horse and climbed on top of the high riverbank.

Manchu: amasi tuwaci uksin dengse ekcin be tafame muterakū.
English: Looking behind me, I saw that armored soldier Dengse could not climb onto the bank.

Manchu: hūlha amcame jifi sacirede. dengse golofi beye haidarara jakade. sirdan jebele. morin-i karhama sacibuha.
English: One rebel caught up with him and hacked at him. Because Dengse was scared, he ducked, turning his body on one side, so the rebel hit the quiver and the horse’s croup.

Manchu: dengse tuheke. bi tere hūlha be gabtame tuhebuhe.
English: As Dengse fell off the horse, I shot the rebel, and made him fall down.

Manchu: geli emu hūlha be we waha be sarkū.
English: Who killed the other rebel, I do not know.

Manchu: tuwaci dengse hūwangiyahakūbi. ebšeme mini tu be gaifi. bošome wame hoton dade isinafi.
English: I looked to make sure that Dengse had not been harmed, then quickly got hold of my flag, and pushing and killing reached the base of the city wall.

Manchu: tuwaci. hūlha hoton dade jursu fik seme faidafi belhehebi.
English: One could see that the rebels at the base of the wall were ready, thickly lined up in a two-echelon formation

Manchu: hoton-i ningguci poo sindambi.
English: They were also firing cannons from the top of the wall.

Manchu: cooha bargiyara buren-i jilgan be donjime. musei cooha uthai yooni amasi bederehe.
English: As our soldiers heard the bugle signal for the withdrawal of the troops, they immediately turned back all together.

Manchu: jafaha hūlha de fonjici. fudaraka hūlhai holo wang. u ši fan juwe tumen isire hūlha. sunja sufan. holo jiyanggiyun hu guwe bing. lio ki lung. huwang ming sede afabufi afanjiha seme alambi.
English: Then we interrogated captured rebels who reported: “The false prince of the resisting rebels Wu Shifan sent an order to the false generals Hu Guobing, Liu Qilong, and Huang Ming, and they have come to fight with twenty thousand infantry rebel troops and five elephants.”

Manchu: orin juwe de gui hūwa sy de ibefi
English: On the twenty-second we advanced to Guihuasi,

Manchu: hontoho cooha be fiyanjilabufi. hontoho cooha be gaifi hoton be kara ulan keremu weilerede, bi genehe.
English: half of the army was positioned in the rear, and the other half was to construct ramparts and moats around the city. I went.

Manchu: ulan keremu šanggafi ing gurifi. afara wan ara seme selgiyehe.
English: Once ramparts and moats had been prepared, we moved the encampment, and we were ordered to make assault ladders.

Manchu: orin ninggude wan arafi. dobori dulime ing-ni keremu sahaha.
English: On the twenty-sixth, after the ladders had been made, we dug a moat during the night around the encampment.

Manchu: orin nadan de amba jiyangiyūn musei coohai gajiha. irgen-i hehe juse be gemu sinda seme selgiyehe.
English: On the twenty-seventh the Field Marshal gathered our troops and ordered that all our troops should free the women and children of the local people that they had taken with them.

Manchu: beise cooha be gaifi yūn nan de isinjiha
