English: The Beise reached Yunnan with his army.

Manchu: ilan biyai ice ilade
English: On the third of the third month

Manchu: hoton be akūmbume kara ulan feteme deribuhe.
English: we started to erect ramparts around the city.

Manchu: bi ineggidari genehe.
English: I went every day.

Manchu: hūlhai holo jiyangiyūn emke. jai musei afarade meitebuhe bayara. uksin. kutule juwe tanggū baime jihe.
English: One false rebel general and two hundred bayara, armored soldiers, and servants who had been cut off during our second assault came seeking refuge.

Manchu: jiyangiyūn ambasa yūn nan-i babe tabcilaki seme
English: The generals and the high officials wanted to storm Yunnanfu

Manchu: ilan inenggi hebešefi. beise jangtai. dzungdu dzai ioi r'ung. tidu sangge ojorakū ofi nakaha.
English: after holding council for three days, Beise Jangtai, Governor-general Cai Yurong, and Provincial Commander Sangge ruled it out because it could not be done.

Manchu: juwan de beise-i emgi kara ba be dendefi. ulan fetehe.
English: On the tenth we divided up the perimeter of the siege with the Beise’s, and dug a moat.

Manchu: orin sunja de hūlhai holo da jiyangiyūn ma boo. ping yuwai fu be tuwa sindafi. ini hehe juse be durifi gamaha
English: On the twenty-fifth the false rebel general Ma Bao burned Pingyuanfu, and seized his women and children.

Manchu: gūsin de hoton be kara keremu ulan šanggafi. geli ing gurihe.
English: On the thirteenth we completed the construction of fortifications and moats around the city, and moved the encampment again.

Manchu: irgen-i boo be efulefi. boo aranuha.
English: The houses of the civilians had been destroyed, and we built houses.

Manchu: ba dendefi. ing-ni ulan keremu weilehe.
English: After dividing up the area, we made moats and ramparts the encampment.

Manchu: duin biyai ice sunjade. poo tai sahaha
English: On the fifth of the fourth month we erected artillery platforms.

Manchu: ice nadan de bi harkasi nimeme
English: On the seventh I fell ill with fever.

Manchu: julergi be dailara jiyangiyūn mujan. gui jeo ci emu nirui juwete cooha be gajime yūn nan bade jihe.
English: The Generalissimo Conqueror of the South Mujan came to Yunnan from Guizhou at the head of a force of two soldiers from each company.

Manchu: sunja biyai ice sunja de. yūn nan-i hoton be kara ulan jursu fetehe.
English: On the fifth of the fifth month we built a two-layer wall rampart around Yunnanfu.

Manchu: ambarame agafi ing mukede gaibufi.
English: After a very heavy rain our camp was flushed away by the water

Manchu: tatara ba akū.
English: no place to pitch tents.

Manchu: mini beye nimere ujen.
English: My illness grew worse.

Manchu: kutule se gemu nimeme ofi. ujen coohai janggin li de dzan mimbe. inu tatan de gamaha bihe.
English: Since my servants had also taken ill, the Hanjun Adjutant Li Dezan had me carried to his tent.

Manchu: hūlha ma boo cu hiong fu be gaiha seme donjifi.
English: We heard that the rebel Ma Bao had occupied the prefectural town of Chuxiong.

Manchu: beise. amba jiyangiyūn acafi hebešefi.
English: The Beise and the Field Marshal met to deliberate.

Manchu: bayara emu nirui ilan. aliha cooha emu nirui ilan. gabsihiyan juwe tanggū. ujen cooha juwe tanggū. uheri be hebei amban hife. meiren-i janggin masitai. araha meiren-i janggin herbu. beise meyen-i meiren-i janggin todai. huwase sede afabufi.
English: They assigned to Councilor Hife, Lieutenant-general Masitai, Commissioned Lieutenant-general Herbu, and the Lieutenant-generals of Beise’s squadron Todai and Huwase, the command of a force of three bayara guards and three Manchu-Mongol cavalrymen from each company, 200 vanguard soldiers, and 200 Hanjun soldiers.

Manchu: tidu sangge de niowanggiyan tu cooha emu tumen be afabufi, cu hiong ni baru unggihe
English: they also assigned to Provincial Commander Sangge the command of 10,000 Green Standard troops, and sent them to Chuxiong.

Manchu: orin ilade yūn nan be kara mei huwa juwang hadahan hadaha.
English: On the twenty-third we nailed together plum trees to make a stockade around Yunnan city

Manchu: ilan ursu ulan fetehe
English: erected a three-layer rampart

Manchu: beise ini coohai tuwakiyaha ba labdu seme futalafi. komso ojoro jakade.
English: The Beise thought that the places protected by his troops were many, but, after taking measurements, they turned out to be few.

Manchu: yoktakū ofi. ini niowanggiyan tu cooha sunja minggan. manju cooha duin tanggū be bi gi guwan-i bade tuwakiyabume unggihe.
English: since he was embarrassed, he sent 5,000 of his Green Standard troops, and 400 of his Manchu troops to protect the Biji.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn juwan nadan de diyan cy hu-i bilten dalirame babe dendefi.
English: On the seventeenth the Field Marshal distributed positions along the marshes of the Dianchi Lake.

Manchu: yūn nan-i muke jugun be lashalame keremu ulan weilefi.
English: He had a continuous line of fortifications built in order to cut in two the waterways to Yunnanfu.

Manchu: niowanggiyan tu de afabufi. beise-i manju cooha be gocika.
English: Then he assigned the Green Standard troops, and withdrew the Manchu troops of the Beise.

Manchu: ninggun biyai ice ninggude
English: On the sixth day of the sixth month

Manchu: tidu sangge. hūlhai jiyangiyūn ma boo be ambarame gidaha seme boolaha.
English: it was reported that Provincial Commander Sangge had inflicted a crushing defeat on the rebel general Ma Bao.

Manchu: beise-i coohai kutule. niowanggiyan tu se guwali-i de šeng kiyoo de mei huwa juwang hadahan ganame.
English: The servants of the soldiers of the Beise and the Green Standard soldiers went to the Desheng Bridge, on the outskirts, to collect plum-tree stakes.

Manchu: boo be efuleme genefi. hoton-i hūlha de ilan tanggū fungeme meitebuhe.
English: When they went to pull down the houses, over 300 of them were cut off by the rebels inside the city.

Manchu: horibuha irgen jeterengge akū ofi. guwalici baime duin tanggū funcere haha hehe juse jifi.
English: Because the people besieged had nothing to eat, over 400 men, women, and children came venturing out of the suburbs.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn jakūn gūsai feyengge cooha niyalma de. hūda salibume buhe.
English: The Field Marshal established their price, and then sold them to the wounded soldiers of the Eight Banners.

Manchu: ineku inenggi keremu dorgi de kaicara jilgan be donjifi.
English: On the same day a loud noise was heard from inside the ramparts.

Manchu: bi katunjame ilif i tuwaci
English: With effort I got up to see

Manchu: hulhai karun alin ci wasifi. musei orho ganaha kutule be jafafi gamahabi.
English: An enemy patrol coming down from the mountain had captured our servants who had gone out to collect grass.

Manchu: juwan ilan de nartai hiya. beging ci isinjifi. dolo nikan morin baimbi seme.
English: On the thirteenth the imperial guard Nartai came from Beijing saying that the Imperial Stables requested Chinese horses.

Manchu: beise. jiyanggiyun. ambasa gemu juwete ilata cuwan ma morin buhe.
English: The Beise, the generals, and the councilors gave two or three Chuan Ma horses each.

Manchu: dergici. hafan coohai sain be fonjiha.
English: on behalf of the emperor inquired about the health of officers and soldiers.

Manchu: nartai ilan inenggi yūn nan-i murdeme kaha babe tuwafi genehe.
English: After having inspected for three days the locations of the siege around Yunnanfu, Nartai left.

Manchu: gūsai ejen hife se cuhiong ci cooha be gaifi. coohai morin mohoho seme bederere jakade.
English: Lieutenant-general Hife and others, at the head of the troops from Chuxiong, came back on account of the fact that both soldiers and horses were exhausted.

Manchu: beise. amba jiyangiyūn se jili banjifi. hife sei marame gidabuha hūlha ma boo-i cooha be fargarakū tabcilafi bederehe turgunde. wakalame wesimbumbi seme gisurefi.
English: The Beise and the Field Marshal were incensed, and said that they would submit a memorial to the throne indicting Hife and his men, on the ground that, refusing they had not pursued the soldiers of the rebel Ma Bao after these had been defeated, but simply turned back after plundering.

Manchu: amala nakafi. damu numere morin akū janggin cooha be teile halafi. amasi cuhiong fude unggihe.
English: they later desisted; instead, they merely replaced those officers and soldiers who were ill or had no horses, and sent back to the provincial city of Chuxiong.

Manchu: nadan biyai juwan de mini beye mangga ofi iliha.
English: On the tenth day of the seventh month, I felt stronger and could stand up.

Manchu: hūlha maboo jergi holo jiyangiyūn sunja. dzung bing juwe dahame jihe be. beging de benehe.
English: The rebel Mao Bao together with five other false generals and two false regional commanders came to surrender, and were sent to Beijing.

Manchu: juwan emude gui jeo ci bele ciyangliyang be uheri tuwame icihiyara ashan-i da foron jihe.
English: On the eleventh the Superintendent of Provisions and Sub-Chancellor of the Grand Secretariat Foron arrived from Guizhou.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn. mimbe beidere jurgan-i jangin sindaha. jakūn gūsai ufaraha uksin-i oron de. etubure be anaha.
English: The Field Marshal appointed me to the post of officer in the Board of Punishments to fill the vacancy in place of a dead armored soldier of the Eight Banners.

Manchu: jakūn biyai orin duin de
English: On the twenty-fourth of the eighth month

Manchu: gūsai ejen gargan. sycuwan-i giyan cang fuci. bayara emu nirui juwete. aliha cooha emu nirui juwete. si an fui meiren-i janggin unggai golo cooha juwe tanggū be gaifi jime. yūn nan de isinjiha.
English: Lieutenant-general Gargan, in command of a force of two bayara guards and one Manchu Cavalryman from each company, together with Brigadier-general Unggai, who was in command of two hundred provincial troops from Xi’an prefectural city, arrived in Yunnan from the prefectural city of Giyan Cang Fu, in Sycuwan

Manchu: uyūn biyai ice ninggude
English: On the sixth of the ninth month

Manchu: kutule uksin-i eberi ojorakūngge be baicame nakabufi
English: upon examination, those among the servants and the armored soldiers who were weak and could not proceed further were allowed to stop.

Manchu: nimekulehe edelehe hafan cooha be baicafi
English: The officers and soldiers who were ill or disabled were also examined

Manchu: ufaraha janggin coohai giran be. gala de emte janggin. gūsa de sunja uksin be tucibufi. ging hecen-i baru jurambuha.
English: All the corpses of dead officers and soldiers were removed by one officer from each wing and five armored soldiers from each banner, then were sent to the capital.

Manchu: ice uyūn de gūsai ejen jihari ufarafi.
English: On the ninth Lieutenant-general Jihari died.

Manchu: baturu bodohonggo jiyangiyūn joo liyang dung se sycuwan-i goloi sui i fuci emu nirui ilata cooha. niowanggiyan tu juwe tumen be gaifi jime. yūn nan de isinjiha.
English: Heroic Strategist General Zhao Liangdong and others, with a force of three soldiers from each company and 20,000 Green Standard troops, arrived in Yunnan from the prefectural city of Sui yi, in Sichuan.

Manchu: tuwaci cira boco wasifi. yafahan niyalma labdu.
English: Looking at them, their faces showed an emaciated complexion, and many soldiers were on foot.

Manchu: fonjici jeterengge akū bime. ehe sukdun de goifi. niyalma morin ambula bucehe nimehe sembi.
English: Asked about their condition, they replied that they had had nothing to eat, had been struck by foul vapors, and people and horses had become ill and died in great numbers.

Manchu: juwan de amba jiyangiyūn tuhai mansi ci beging de bederehe. kemungge cin wang-ni guwangsi ci beging de bederehe be donjiha.
English: On the tenth we heard that Field Marshal Tuhai126 had returned to Beijing from Shaanxi, and the Frugal Prince of the Blood had also gone back to Beijing from Guangxi.

Manchu: yūn nan-i hoton-i dorgi hūlha emu juwe-i dahame jiderengge lakcan akū
English: Rebels from inside Yunan city continuously came to surrender in ones or twos.

Manchu: fonjici hoton-i dorgi yuyume niyalma-i yali jembi sembi.
English: When they were interrogated, they said that inside the city were starving and eating human flesh.

Manchu: gemu musei coohai urse sain haha juse be sonjome gidame. amba haha be amba jiyangiyūn de benembi.
English: Everybody in our army chose the best male children as booty, and sent the adult males to the Field Marshal.

Manchu: bele lakcafi. emu hule udarade orin yan bumbi.
English: As rice was becoming scarce, one needed 20 ounces of silver to buy a bushel of rice.

Manchu: irgen ambula yuyume bucehe.
English: Many people starved to death.

Manchu: juwan emu de jalan-i janggin fafuri be kūwaran-i da sindara jakade. mimbe amba jiyangiyūn tuwafi. jalan-i janggin sindaha.
English: On the eleventh, because colonel Fafuri had been appointed as camp commander, the Field Marshal considered me, and appointed me colonel.

Manchu: gūwa habšaci donjiha akū.
English: If others have filed a complaint, I am not aware of it.

Manchu: juwan biyai juwan de ibefi
English: On the tenth of the tenth month we advanced.

Manchu: muse hoton ci sunja ba-i huwang tu po-i emu girin-i alirame. ulan fetefi keremu sahame
English: we dug moats and built ramparts along the mountainside of Huangtupo, 5 li from the city

Manchu: bi inenggidari genehe
English: I went every day

Manchu: ulan keremu šanggafi kubuhe fulgiyan. kubuhe lamun-i ing gurifi tuwakiyaha.
English: Once the fortifications were completed, we moved the encampments of the Bordered Red and Bordered Blue Banners, and guarded them.

Manchu: hūlhai sindaha poo ing de tuhebi dababi
English: The rebels’ artillery rounds were either hitting the camp or falling beyond it.

Manchu: niyalma gemu dalda de boo araha
English: The people all built their houses in concealed spots.

Manchu: bi emhun meni meni giyan bi seme šehun bai den bade boo araha.
English: With everyone having one’s own idea, only I built my dwelling on a high spot in a barren area.

Manchu: juwan uyūn de hebei amban gūsai ejen gargan. maci. lebei. tui janggin ehene. meiren-i janggin hungsilu se hontoho cooha be gaifi. hoton ci ilan bai in ding san alin de ibembi seme selgiyehe.
English: On the nineteenth it was ordered that Councilors and Lieutenant-generals Gargan, Maci, and Lebei, Major-general of the Guards Ehene, and Lieutenant-general Hong Shilu at the head of half the army should advance to the Yinding Mountain three miles from the city.

Manchu: mini beye. janggin šušu. sindai. gelibu. funde bošokū laisu. margi. solho. tanggū cooha be gaifi. yamji ibehe.
English: I myself, at the head of Captains Mumu, Sindai, and Gelibu, Lieutenants Laisu, Margi, and Solho, and 100 soldiers, advanced during the evening.

Manchu: dobori ulan feterede. bi solho. margi. kelibu be gaifi. moro ilibufi ulan feteme.
English: As we were digging a moat at night, I took along Solho, Margi, and Gelibu to dig after having lifted baskets

Manchu: niyalma tome bucetei hacihiyambi.
English: every man was crushed to death.

Manchu: hoton-i hūlha poo miyoocan geretele šorgime sindame.
English: The rebels inside the city fired the muskets and cannons until dawn.

Manchu: muhaliyan juleri amala emdubei tuhebi.
English: Projectiles were falling ceaselessly in front and behind.

Manchu: musei niyalma. morin poo miyoocan de ambula kokiraha.
English: Many of my men and horses were injured by the shots.

Manchu: jai inenggi ulan keremu uthai šanggaha.
English: The next day moats and ramparts had been fully completed.

Manchu: orin emude niowanggiyan tu-i cooha. ujen coohai janggin. cooha be hūnggi ibebume.
English: On the twenty-first, Green Standard troops and Hanjun officers and soldiers were ordered to move to the front.

Manchu: musei cooha fiyamjilafi. dobori teni gocika.
English: Our soldiers served in the rear, and were withdrawn only at night.

Manchu: kubuhe lamun be yen ding san de baita bici. uthai dame gene seme selgiyehe.
English: Then it was ordered that, since there were problems on the Yinding Mountain, the Bordered Blue Banner should immediately go there to help.

Manchu: orin uyūn de hūlhai holo jiyangiyūn siyan ioi. ho jin jung. u guwe ju. huwang ming. lin tiyan king se hoton be alibume dahafi.
English: On the twenty-ninth the false rebel general Xian Yu, He Jinzhong, Wu Guozhu, Huang Ming, and Lin Tianqing surrendered offering the city.

Manchu: holo lio meo jiyangiyūn g’u juwang tu. holo wang u ši fan-i uju be alibume jihe.
English: presented the heads of the false General-regent Gu Zhuangtu and of the false prince Wu Shifan.

Manchu: dobori uthai yūn nan-i hoton-i duka tome meiren-i janggin emte. tui janggin. kūwaran-i da emte. gūsa tome jalan-i janggin emte. cooha duin tanggū tucibufi uksilefi tuwakiyabuha
English: At night, one brigadier-general, one Major-general, one camp commander, and one colonel and 400 soldiers from each banner were sent to each of the gates of Yunnan city, and were put on guard duty in full armor.

Manchu: cooha kutule se holtome hoton de dosifi
English: Soldiers and civilians stealthily entered the city

Manchu: yuyuhe hehe juse be hūlhame ambula tucibuhe.

Manchu: tuwaci musei coohai boo musei coohai tatan. manju booi adali uce fa sindahabi.
English: Looking at them, our troops’ dwellings and army tents were fitted with doors and windows, just like Manchu houses.

Manchu: orin juwe de dzoo ši de bi boo dendefi tehe.
English: On the twenty-second lodgings were assigned and I stayed in Caoshi.

Manchu: booci hadafun. sandari okdoho.
English: Hadafun and Sandari came from home to greet

Manchu: bi mancang be takūrafi ama eniyei elhe be fonjime unggihe.
English: I sent Mancang to inquire about the health of my father and mother.

Manchu: ging jeo. yuwan jeo-i siden muke hahi bime. hargi turgen. ambula sengguwecuke.
English: The currents between Jingzhou and Yuanzhou are strong, and the fast rapids are terribly frightening.

Manchu: wasihūn muke eme minggan ninggun tanggū susai ba funcembi.
English: The water flows downstream for over 1,650 li.

Manchu: inenggidari efime sain jaka jeme. bi damu boode genembi seme urgunjembi.
English: Playing every day, eating good food, I rejoiced to be just going back home.

Manchu: ninggun biyai orin de ashan-i da foron wesimbufi. coohai edelehe juwan ilan biyai ciyanliyang. duin biyai orho liyoo be faitaha turgunde jakūn gūsai gabsihiyan bayara. aliha cooha gemu beise de habšaha.
English: On the twentieth of the sixth month, after a memorial submitted by the Sub-Chancellor of the Grand Secretariat Foron, because the soldiers’ overdue salary of thirteen months and forage payment of four months were forfeited, the Eight Banners’ Vanguard, Guards and Cavalry regiments all complained to the Beise.

Manchu: orin ninggude gūsai ejen mujan jai meyen-i cooha. hūlhai hehe juse be werifi. hūlhai hafan be teile be gaifi. gingjeo fude isinjiha.
English: On the twenty-sixth Lieutenant-general Mujan and the soldiers of the squadron left the wives and children of the rebels, and only brought rebel officials back and reached JingZhou Fu.

Manchu: orin jakūn de giyang-ni muke biltefi. huwang tan dalan efujefi
English: On the twenty-eighth the river overflowed, the dam at Huangtan broke

Manchu: giyang ling. miyang yang. ciyang giyang ilan hiyan-i ba. tanggū ba onco. ninggun tanggū ba golmin. muke be birebufi.
English: the territory of the three counties of Jiangling, Mianyang, and Qianjiang was flooded over an area 100-li wide and 600-li long.

Manchu: dzoo ši gašan yooni muke de gaibuha.
English: The village of Caoshi was completely flushed away by the water.

Manchu: bi jidere muke be den bade genefi tuwaci huwanggar seme. alin-i gese den mukdefi. ilan da den ajige dalan be dartai birefi.
English: I had moved to a higher spot, and could observe how the incoming water rose with a thundering noise as high as a mountain, then suddenly smashed against the only 3 da high small dam.

Manchu: meni tehe boo gemu mukede gaibuhabi.
English: The houses where we had been staying were all swept away by the water.

Manchu: kubuhe lamun gemu cuwan jafafi. aciha tebufi. tehe boo mukede gaibuha turgun be bi beise de alafi.
English: After the Bordered Blue Banner got hold of all the boats, and luggage had been loaded, I told the Beise how the houses where we were billeted had been destroyed by the flood.

Manchu: tere amargi guwali-i loosa turire diyan-i irgen-i boo be gaifi gurifi tataha
English: he took the houses of innkeepers that Loosa had rented in the northern suburbs, and after they moved we lodged there.

Manchu: nadan biyai ice juwe de
English: On the second of the seventh month

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn laita. jakūci meyen-i cooha. gūsai ejen hife sei ilaci meyen-i cooha. hūlhai hafan be gaifi gingjeo de isinjifi.
English: Field Marshal Laita, with the troops of the eighth squadron, and Lieutenant-general Hife, at the head of the third squadron and of the rebel officials, arrived in Jingzhou.

Manchu: guwangsi meyen-i cooha be ša ši de bargiyafi
English: they gathered the troops of the Guangxi squadron at Shashi

Manchu: boo gaire de. beise burakū ofi. cooha gemu maikan arafi. menggun tucibufi boo aranuha.
English: At the moment of assigning billets, the Beise did not give [them] any. Because of this, all the troops had to set up their tents, and paid to build their houses.

Manchu: bi inu boo araha.
English: I also built a house.

Manchu: orin duide tui janggin ehene-i ilaci meyen. gūsai ejen lasai-i duici meyen- i cooha isinjifi.
English: On the twenty-fourth the soldiers of the third squadron, under Major-general Ehene, and those of the fourth squadron, under Lieutenant-general Lasai, arrived.

Manchu: musei wang-ni baita-i turgunde. lasai. ehene. masitai. lio hiyan jung se gūsai janggisa be isabufi. boro-i sorson be gaifi. muse ilan inenggi gasame dobori duliha.
English: Because of the matter concerning our Prince, Lasai, Ehene, Masitai, and Liu Xianzhong gathered the Banner officers, collected the hats’ tassels, and we mourned for three days holding night vigils.

Manchu: orin nadan de muke olhon-i hafan cooha be cihangga be tuwame tuciburede. bi olhon be genembi seme anggalafi tucike.
English: On the twenty-seventh, when they made officers and soldiers register whether [to go back] by land or water according to their preference, I requested to go by land and registered.

Manchu: jakūn biyai ice juwe de gūsai ejen gargan sei sunja ci meyen-i cooha isinjiha.
English: On the second of the eighth month the soldiers of the fifth squadron under Lieutenant-general Gargan arrived.

Manchu: juwan de tui janggin syge-i ningguci meyen-i cooha isinjiha.
English: On the tenth the soldiers of the sixth squadron under Major-general Sige arrived.

Manchu: orin-i dobori
English: On the night of the twentieth

Manchu: edelehe orho liyoo-i baharakū jalin. amba jiyangiyūn-i tataha boo be. toome giye tiye bithe arafi. sirdan de huwaitafi gabtaha.
English: because the overdue fodder and provisions had not yet been received, [someone] wrote a cursing letter of denunciation, fastened it to an arrow, and shot it at the house where the Field Marshal was staying.

Manchu: musei coohai urse dahaha hulhai jiyangiyūn ho jin jung-ni tatan be gidanafi
English: Some of our soldiers went to raid the tent of the surrendered rebel general He Jinzhong.

Manchu: umai jaka baha akū elemangga koro baha.
English: Not only did they not find anything at all, but, on the contrary, suffered injuries.

Manchu: orin jakūn de olhon be emu nirui ilata bayara.ilata aliha cooha genembi.
English: On the twenty-eighth three bayara guards and three cavalrymen from each company proceed by land

Manchu: muke be emu nirui duite bayara. nadanta aliha cooha amala genembi.
English: four bayara guards and seven cavalrymen from each company proceed by water afterwards

Manchu: muke olhon be generengge gūnin cihangga sonjokini.
English: Those going by water or land were to be selected according to personal preference.

Manchu: orin uyūn de amba jiyangiyūn. geren kūwaran-i da. janggisa be gaifi. jakūn ihan  be wafi.
English: On the twenty-ninth the Field Marshal gathered the head of all camp commanders and officers, then killed eight cows

Manchu: tere boihon mutubume araha terkin de dobofi
English: he made offerings on top of a terrace made of stamped earth.

Manchu: tere tu de hengkileme burdeme wecefi. yali be umbuha
English: he performed the sacrificial ceremony prostrating himself and blowing the conch in front of the standard, then buried the flesh.

Manchu: cooha jurafi susai ba yabufi. wang sy po de ing iliha
English: The army set off, after covering 50 li, and camped overnight in Wangsipo.

Manchu: uyūn biyai ice de.
English: On the first day of the ninth month

Manchu: nadanju ba yabufi. lung bei sere kiyoo de ing iliha.
English: we covered 70 li and set up camp near a bridge called Lung Bei.

Manchu: ice juwe de ninju ba yabufi ging men jeo de iliha.
English: On the second we covered 60 li and stopped at Jinmenzhou

Manchu: ging men jeo julgei nan giyun.
English: Jinmenzhou is the Nanjun of old

Manchu: ice ilade mi kiyoo i be muse dulefi
English: On the third we passed Shiqiaoyi

Manchu: jakūnju ba yabufi ing iliha
English: set up camp after having covered 80 li

Manchu: ice duide muse li i be dulefi. jakūnju ba yabufi ing iliha.
English: On the fourth we passed Liyi, and camped after having covered 80 li.

Manchu: amba jiyangiyūn. siyang yang giyang de. cuwan dendebume coohai jurgan-i janggin sabe unggirede. mimbe tucibuhe.
English: When the Field Marshal dispatched various officials of the Board of War to the Xiangyang River in order to distribute the boats, he sent me.

Manchu: bi tere dobori jurafi. susai ba yabufi. i ceng hiyan-i diyan fang de tataha.
English: I left that same night, proceeded for 50 li, and then made a stop at an inn in Yicheng county.

Manchu: ice sunja de. bi duici ging de jurafi. emu tanggū orin ba yabufi. siyang yang fude isinjifi.
English: On the fifth I left on the fourth hour, and after covering 120 li reached the Xiangyang Fu.

Manchu: hiowande-i dilu morin-i fekuhe tan hi bira be tuwaci fahabi.
English: There I observed that the Tanhi river, over which Xuande jumped riding his dilu horse, had dried up.

Manchu: wehe be mini morin–i wahan forofi ejehebi.
English: The hoof of my horse carved the rock to make a record.

Manchu: giyang-ni dalin de jifi. bi bai hafan de cuwan be baicame gaifi.
English: Once I reached the bank of the river, at the local officials’, I inspected and requisitioned the boats.

Manchu: bi beise meyen de orin ilan cuwan. amba jiyangiyūn meyen de orin juwe cuwan dendefi
English: I assigned twenty-three boats to the Beise’s squadron, and twenty-two to the squadron of the Field Marshal.

Manchu: mini morin. aciha be cuwan de tebufi bira doofi
English: I loaded my horses and luggage on a boat and crossed the river

Manchu: fan ceng-ni hoton-i dolo. bi boo baifi tataha
English: I found a house inside the city of Fancheng and lodged there.

Manchu: jai inenggi amba cooha isinjifi. juwe inenggi bira dooha
English: The next day the bulk of the army arrived, and it took two days to cross the river.

Manchu: ice jakūn de muse jurafi lioi yang i be duleme. jakūnju ba yabufi iliha.
English: On the eighth we set off and passed Liuyang village, then stopped after covering 80 li.

Manchu: ereci julesi gurgu elgiyen
English: From there onwards beastes were plentiful.

Manchu: ice uyūn de sin ye hiyan be duleme. uyūnju ba yabufi ing iliha
English: On the ninth we passed Xinye county, and set up camp after covering 90 li.

Manchu: juwan de muse wa diyan be duleme. nadanju ba yabufi nan yang fude ing iliha.
English: On the tenth we passed Wadian, marched for 70 li, and set up camp in Nanyang Fu.

Manchu: kungming-ni susu o lung k’ang de genefi
English: went to Wolonggang, birthplace of Kong Ming

Manchu: tuwaci alin ajige alarame ba necin.
English: one can see low hills surrounded by plains.

Manchu: muse jug’oliyang-ni miyoo de. boigon-i oren arahabi
English: Then we made an earthen statue inside the temple of Zhuge Liang.

Manchu: ambasa cooha geme hengkilehe. tere de menggun buhe.
English: All the high officials and soldiers prostrated and made offerings of silver to it.

Manchu: bi hengkilefi bei bithe be tuwaha.
English: I prostrated and then observed a stelae inscription.

Manchu: juwan emu de nadanju ba yadufi bo wang i de ing iliha.
English: On the eleventh we covered 70 li and camped at Bowangyi.

Manchu: gūlmahūn ulhuma elgiyen
English: Hares and pheasants were abundant.

Manchu: coohai urse balai niyamniyara de. juwan funceme uksin kutule gabtabuha.
English: The rank and file soldiers were shooting arrows in a careless manner, and hit over ten armored soldiers and servants.

Manchu: juwe uksin bucehe. be beidefi beye hūda bubuhe
English: Two armored soldiers died. We judged the case and a monetary compensation was paid for the bodies.

Manchu: emu inenggi ududu morin gabtabumbi.
English: In a single day many horses were shot.

Manchu: mini dolo geleme gūnime
English: In my heart I was frightened and pondered

Manchu: bi juwan aniya afame yabufi funcehe. ergen dain de gaibuhakū
English: I have served on a military campaign for ten years, and my life has not been taken by battle

Manchu: ere niyamniyame bahanarakū coohai urse de guweke seme bi olhošome.
English: I must be careful to avoid those soldiers who are incapable of shooting from horseback.

Manchu: juwan juwede muse jakūnju ba yabufi. ioi jeo de ing iliha.
English: On the twelfth we set camp in Yuzhou after having covered 80 li.

Manchu: juwan ilan de muse jakūnju sunja ba yabufi. boo an i be dulefi ing iliha
English: On the thirteenth we proceeded for 85 li, passed Bao’anyi and then set up camp.

Manchu: juwan duin de muse hūwang ho bira de cuwan dendeme. coohai jurgan-i janggin be unggirede.
English: On the fourteenth we distributed the boats at the Yellow River and sent the officers of the Board of War.

Manchu: bi boo be ele kidume ofi. amba jiyangiyūn de anggalafi tesei emgi genehe.
English: since I longed more and more for home, I submitted a request to the Field Marshal and to go with them.

Manchu: bi yei hiyan be duleme. uyūnju ba yabufi. diyan fang de tataha
English: I passed Ye county, covered 90 li, and then rested in an inn.

Manchu: tofohonde bi siyang ceng hiyan-i ši gu jen be duleme
English: On the fifteenth I passed Shiguzhen in Xiangcheng county

Manchu: emu tanggū dehi ba yabufi. muse irgen-i boode tataha.
English: After proceeding for 140 li, we stopped at the house of local people.

Manchu: juwan ninggude bi sin jeng hiyan. k’o diyan i be duleme
English: On the sixteenth I passed Guodianyi in Xinzheng county

Manchu: jakūnju ba yabufi. diyan fang de tataha.
English: lodged at an inn after having covered 80 li.

Manchu: juwan nadan de jeng jeo. hingje hiyan be duleme.
English: On the seventeenth I passed the Zhengzhou and Xingze counties

Manchu: nadanju ba yabufi. hūwang ho birai dalin de isinafi
English: after covering 70 li reached the bank of the Yellow River

Manchu: tubade bi maikan arafi tataha.
English: There I pitched my tent.

Manchu: tuwaci birai muke fafi isheliyan.
English: One could see that the river’s water had dried up and become narrow

Manchu: eyen udu turgen seme. ambula olhocuka ba akū.
English: although the current was fast, there were no terribly frightening places.

Manchu: bai hafan de bi cuwan be baicame gaifi.
English: At the local officials’ I inspected the boats and requisitioned them.

Manchu: juwan jakūn de. bi beise meyen de morin-i cuwan dehi ninggun. amba jiyanggiyun-i meyen de. morin-i cuwan dehi duin dendefi.
English: On the eighteenth I assigned fourty-six boats for the transportation of horses to the Beise’s squadron and fourty-four boats for the transportation of horses to the Field Marshal’s squadron.

Manchu: mini aciha morin be. cuwan de tebufi doofi. bi hūwang ho-i cargi dalin de maikan arafi tataha.
English: After loading my horse and luggage on a boat I crossed the Yellow River and pitched my tent on the opposite bank.

Manchu: juwan uyūnde amba cooha isinjifi.
English: On the nineteenth the bulk of the army arrived.

Manchu: tese hūwang ho bira be jurcenjeme doome. dartai wajifi.
English: They crossed the Yellow River coming and going in opposite direction and completed quickly.

Manchu: muse orin sunja ba yabufi ing iliha
English: We proceeded for 25 li and set up camp.

Manchu: orin de jakūnju muse sunja ba yabufi. sin hiyang hiyan de ing iliha.
English: On the twentieth we proceeded for 85 li and camped in Xinxiang county.

Manchu: booci mancang. gurbu jetere jaka gajime mimbe okdoko.
English: From home Mancang and Gurbu came to greet me bringing foods.

Manchu: bi dobori amgaci ojorakū booi baita be fonjiha.
English: I was not able to sleep at night, and asked about family affairs.

Manchu: orin emude muse ninju ba yabufi. wei hui fude ing iliha.
English: On the twenty-first we proceeded for 60 li and set up camp in Weihuifu.

Manchu: orin juwe de muse ki hiyan be duleme. jakūnju sunja ba yabufi.
English: On the twenty-second we passed Qi county, covering 85 li

Manchu: bi jeo gurun-i cenghiyang bi g’an-i eifu be tuwanafi
English: I went to see the tomb of Chengxiang Bigan of the kingdom of Zhou.

Manchu: miyoo-i boigon-i oren de bi hengkilefi. ing iliha.
English: After kneeling in front of the earthen statue of the temple, I set up the camp.

Manchu: orin ilade muse i kio i be duleme ninju sunja ba yabufi. teng in hiyan de ing iliha.
English: On the twenty-third we passed Yiqiu county and, after having covered 65 li, set up camp in Tengyin county.

Manchu: orin duide muke akū seme. muse dehi ba yabufi
English: On the twenty-fourth, because there was no water, we proceeded for 40 li

Manchu: muse jang de fude ing iliha.
English: We set up camp in Zhangde Fu.

Manchu: orin sunjade nadanju ba yabufi. tsi jeo de ing iliha.
English: On the twenty-fifth we went on for 70 li and camped in Cizhou.

Manchu: bi amba jiyangiyūn-i kūwaran be ilibuha.
English: I erected the encampment of the Field Marshal.

Manchu: orin ninggun de muse nadanju ba yabufi. han dan hiyan de ing iliha.
English: On the twenty-sixth we covered 70 li and camped in the Handan county.

Manchu: orin nadan de muse nadanju ba yabufi. da liyang diyan de ing iliha.
English: On the twenty-seventh we covered 70 li and camped overnight in Daliandian.

Manchu: orin jakūn de muse dehi ba yabufi šun de fude ing iliha.
English: On the twenty-eighth we covered 40 li and camped overnight in Shunde Fu.

Manchu: orin uyūn de dehi muse sunja ba yabufi. fiyanggū gung be acafi
English: On the twenty-ninth, after covering 45 li, we met Duke Fiyanggu

Manchu: susai ba yabufi in dzun de iliha
English: proceeded for 50 li, and stopped at Yincun

Manchu: dergici. beise de gocika morin juwe. amba jiyangiyūn de gocika morin juwe. mujan. gargan. hife sede morin emte. uheri janggin. cooha de amba adun-i morin ilan tanggū. temen gūsin okdoko.
English: The emperor greeted by awarding two imperial horses each to the Beise and the Field Marshal, one regular horse each to Mujan, Gargan, Hife, and others, and a huge group of 300 horses and thirty camels from the imperial herd to officers and soldiers.

Manchu: gemu morin akū niyalma de. hūsun gaisu seme
English: It was ordered to give the strong ones to the people without horses

Manchu: mini beye dobori dulime baicafi. dendeme jakūn gūsa de buhe.
English: I myself stayed up at night to supervise, and to distribute among the Eight Banners.
